Select one other friendly KASRKIN opératif. Until the end of that opératif's next activation, add 1 to its APL stat (to a maximum of 3 after all APL stat changes have been totalled).


This opératif can perform this action twice during its activation, but cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

ploys.description: Place your Clearance Sweep marker in the zone de combat. Whenever a friendly KASRKIN opératif within 5" horizontally of that marker is shooting Un opératif also within 5" horizontally of that marker, that opératif allié's weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule. In the Ready step of the next Strategy phase, remove that marker.
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly KASRKIN opératif that's in cover, you can re-roll one of your dés de défense.

Whenever a friendly KASRKIN opératif is shooting with a hot-shot weapon against a target that's is either not in cover or is being scanned (see Reconnaissance-TROOPER), that weapon has the Piercing Crits 1 weapon rule, or Piercing 1 instead if it's a hot-shot volley gun.  
 **Piercing 1:** The defender collects 1 less Defence die.  
 **Piercing Crits 1:** If you retain any succès critiques, the defender collects 1 less Defence die.

Select one friendly KASRKIN opératif that is more than 3" from opératifs ennemis.
That opératif, and each other friendly KASRKIN opératif that is both within 3" of that opératif and more than 3" from opératifs ennemis,
can immediately perform a free Ruée action in an order of your choice. You cannot use this ploy during the first point tournant.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly KASRKIN opératif performs the Repli action while visible to and within 6" of another friendly KASRKIN opératif that is not dans la portée de contrôle of opératifs ennemis.
After that opératif allié has finished moving, but before that Repli action ends, that other opératif allié can immediately perform a free Tirer action (you can change its order to Engage to do so).

Use this firefight ploy during a friendly KASRKIN opératif's activation, or at the end of the Firefight phase.
Select one of your mission markers or an objective marker.
Until the end of that activation or until the start of the next point tournant respectively, if the total APL of friendly KASRKIN opératifs that contest that marker is 2,
and the total APL of opératifs ennemis that contest it is the same, friendly KASRKIN opératifs control that marker.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly KASRKIN opératif is shooting, after rolling your dés d'attaque if it's shooting Un opératif that's either not in cover or is being scanned (see Reconnaissance-TROOPER). You can re-roll any of your dés d'attaque.

Use this firefight ploy at the start of the Firefight phase. One friendly KASRKIN opératif can immediately perform a 1AP action for free, but it cannot move during that action. You cannot use this ploy if you're the player with initiative.

equipments.description:
Whenever a friendly KASRKIN opératif is shooting Un opératif within 3" of it, ranged weapons on its datacard
(excluding weapons that include 'pistol' in their name, e.g. hot-shot laspistol, all profiles of a plasma pistol, etc.) have the Accurate 1 weapon rule.
Whenever a friendly KASRKIN opératif is shooting Un opératif more than 6" from it, that opératif allié's hot-shot weapons have the Saturate weapon rule.

Once per point tournant, when a friendly KASRKIN opératif is shooting, fighting or retaliating, if you roll two or more fails, you can discard one of them to retain another as a succès normal instead.

Friendly KASRKIN opératifs have the following melee weapon:

|**Name**|**ATK**|**HIT**|**DMG**|
|-----|:-----:|:-----:|:-----:|
|Combat Dagger|3|4+|3/4|

description:
A Kommando is an Ork Boy specialist who prefers to rely on "kunning trikz" instead of fighting his opponents head-on like most other Greenskins.
  
  

Kommandoz serve as the Orks' infiltrators and saboteurs, and are masters of the arts of stealth, ambush, unconventional tactics and striking at the opponent from a totally unexpected quarter.
composition:
A KOMMANDOS KillTeam is composed of:

- 1 KOMMANDO Boss Nob opératif with one of the following options:
  - Slugga; Big Choppa
  - Slugga; Power Klaw
- 9 KOMMANDO opératifs selected from the following list:
  - Bomb Squig (X)
  - Boy
  - Breacha Boy
  - Burna Boy
  - Comms Boy
  - Dakka Boy
  - Grot (X)
  - Rokkit Boy
  - Slasha Boy
  - Snipa Boy

Other than BOY opératifs, your kill team can only include each opératif on this list once.  

(X) These opératifs count as half a selection each, meaning you can select both of them and it's treated as one selection in total.

opTypes.keywords: KOMMANDO, ORK, BOSS NOB

abilities.description: Each friendly KOMMANDO opératif (excluding BOMB SQUIG) can perform the Charge action while it has a conceal order.

**SUPPORT** Select one other friendly KOMMANDO opératif (excluding BOMB SQUIG) visible to and within 6" of this opératif.
Until the end of that opératif's next activation add 1 to its APL stat.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.
This opératif can perform two Combattre actions during its activation

abilities.description: Each friendly KOMMANDO opératif (excluding BOMB SQUIG) can perform the Charge action while it has a conceal order.

You can do one of each of the following once per point tournant:  - One friendly KOMMANDO BOY can perform the Smoke Grenade action - One friendly KOMMANDO BOY can perform the Stun Grenade action  The rules for these actions are found in universal equipment.  
 Performing these actions using this rule does not count towards their action limits (i.e, if you select those grenades from equipment).

abilities.description: This opératif cannot have an Engage order. Whenever this opératif is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g, Seek, Vantage Terrain) except being within 2".
Each friendly KOMMANDO opératif (excluding BOMB SQUIG) can perform the Charge action while it has a conceal order.

Selected a visible point on a terrain feature for this opératif.
Remove this opératif from the zone de combat and set it back up within 1" horizontally of that point in a location it can be placed, not dans la portée de contrôle of opératifs ennemis, and with that point visible to it.
The opératif cannot perform the Operate Hatch action during this action.  

This action is treated as a Repositionner action.
This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi, or during an activation in which it performed the Charge or Repli action (or vice-versa).

opTypes.keywords: KOMMANDO, ORK, SLASHA BOY

abilities.description: After this opératif fights or rretaliates, if it was not hors de combat, you can inflict 1D3 damage on the opératif ennemi in that sequence.

opTypes.keywords: KOMMANDO, ORK, BREACHA BOY

abilities.description: Each friendly KOMMANDO opératif (excluding BOMB SQUIG) can perform the Charge action while it has a conceal order.

Place one of your Breach markers within this opératif's portée de contrôle as close as possible to a terrain feature dans la portée de contrôle of it.
Whenever Un opératif is within 1" of that marker, it treats parts of that terrain feature that are no more than 1" thick as Accessible Terrain.
This opératif can perform this action during the Charge or Repositionner action, and it can do so for 1 less AP during those actions.
Any remaining move distance can be used after it does so.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi or if a terrain feature is not within its portée de contrôle.

opTypes.keywords: KOMMANDO, ORK, BOMB SQUIG

abilities.description:
Whenever this opératif is hors de combat during a battle in which it has not used its explosives, roll 1D6, or 2D6 if you wish.
If any result is a 4+, this opératif performs a free Tirer action with its explosives before it is removed from the zone de combat.

This opératif is ignored for your opponent's kill/elimination op (when it is hors de combat, and when determining your starting number of opératifs). It is also ignored for victory conditions and scoring VPs that require opératifs to "escape", "survive", or be hors de combat by opératifs ennemis (if it escapes/survives/is hors de combat, determining how many opératif must escape/survive/ be hors de combat, etc).

In the Firefight Phase, whenever you determine this opératif's order, you cannot select Conceal.
This opératif cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Ruée, Combattre, Repositionner and Tirer, or use any weapons that are not on its data card.

ploys.description:
Friendly KOMMANDO opératifs' ranged weapons have the Punishing weapon Rule.  
**Punishing:** If you retain any succès critiques, you can retain one of your fails as a succès normal instead of discarding it.

Whenever an opératif ennemi is shooting a friendly KOMMANDO opératif that has a Conceal order, you can retain one of your dés de défense as a succès normal without rolling it (in addition to a cover save, if any).

Each friendly KOMMANDO opératif that is not a valid target for opératifs ennemis, or has a conceal order and is more than 6" from opératifs ennemis, can immediately perform a free Ruée action. You cannot use this ploy during the first point tournant.

Friendly KOMMANDO opératifs' melee weapons have the Balanced weapon rule.  
**Balanced:** Can re-roll one Attack die.
Use this firefight ploy when an dés d'attaque inflicts Normal Damage on a friendly KOMMANDO opératif (excluding BOMB SQUIG and GROT). Ignore that inflicted damage.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly KOMMANDO opératif that has a Conceal order is fighting during an activation in which it has performed the Charge action, you're resolving the first attack die and it is a strike with a succès normal.
Treat that succès normal as a succès critique instead.
Use this firefight ploy at the end of the Firefight phase. Select one friendly KOMMANDO opératif. It can immediately perform a free Combattre action.
Use this firefight ploy when a friendly Kommando opératif is activated, or when its APL stat is changed. Until the start of the next point tournant, you can ignore any changes to its APL stat.

equipments.description:

description:
Legionary kill teams are bitter veterans who possess centuries of combat experience. Some are little more than
ravening killers who desire only to reave, slaughter and despoil. Others are devoted worshippers of the Dark Gods,
seeking to conduct fell rituals in the hope of pleasing their infernal patrons and attaining greater power.
composition:
A LEGIONARIES KillTeam is composed of:

- 1 LEGIONARY opératif selected from the following list:
  - ASPIRING CHAMPION with one option from each of the following:
    - Plasma pistol or tainted bolt pistol
    - Power fist, power maul, power weapon or tainted chainsword  
  - CHOSEN with one of the following options:
    - Plasma pistol; daemon blade
    - Tainted bolt pistol; daemon blade
- 5 LEGIONARY opératifs selected from the following list:
  - ANOINTED
  - BALEFIRE ACOLYTE
  - BUTCHER
  - ICON BEARER with one of the following options:
    - Boltgun; fists
    - Bolt pistol; chainsword  
  - SHRIVETALON
    - WARRIOR with one of the following options:
    - Boltgun; fists
    - Bolt pistol; chainsword    
  - GUNNER with one of the following options:
    - Bolt pistol; flamer; fists
      - Bolt pistol; meltagun; fists
      - Bolt pistol; plasma gun; fists   
  - HEAVY GUNNER with one of the following options:
    - Bolt pistol; heavy bolter; fists
    - Bolt pistol; missile launcher; fists
    - Bolt pistol; reaper chaincannon; fists

Other than WARRIOR opératifs, your kill team can only include each opératif on this list once.

opTypes.keywords: LEGIONARY, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, LEADER, ASPIRING CHAMPION

abilities.description:
During each friendly LEGIONARY opératif's activation, it can perform either two Tirer actions or two Combattre actions.
If it is two Tirer actions, a bolt pistol, boltgun or tainted bolt pistol must be selected for at least one of them.  

Each friendly LEGIONARY opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.

abilities.abilityName: In The Eyes Of The Gods
abilities.description: Once during each of this opératif's activations, if it incapacitates an opératif ennemi, add 1 to its APL stat until the end of that activation.

Whenever you select a LEGIONARY opératif for the battle, you must select one of the following keywords for it to have for that battle: KHORNE, NURGLE, SLAANESH, TZEENTCH, UNDIVIDED.
Each opératif's keyword can be different, but a BALEFIRE ACOLYTE opératif cannot have the KHORNE keyword.  

Friendly LEGIONARY opératifs have an additional rule determined by this keyword. In addition, LEGIONARY ploys have additional benefits for opératifs with the relevant keyword.

options.description:
This opératif's melee weapons have the Severe weapon rule.  
**Severe:** If you do not retain any succès critiques, you can change one of your succès normaux to a succès critique. Any rules that take effect as a result of retaining a succès critique (e.g. Devastating, Piercing Crits, etc.) still do.
Whenever Normal Dmg of 3 or more is inflicted on this opératif, roll one D6: on a 5+, subtract 1 from that inflicted damage.
Add 1" to this opératif's Move stat.

This opératif's ranged weapons have the Severe weapon rule.  
**Severe:** If you do not retain any succès critiques, you can change one of your succès normaux to a succès critique. Any rules that take effect as a result of retaining a succès critique (e.g. Devastating, Piercing Crits, etc.) still do.
Whenever this opératif is shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against an opératif ennemi within 6" of it, this opératif's weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule.

If it is two Tirer actions, a bolt pistol, boltgun or tainted bolt pistol must be selected for at least one of them.  

Each friendly LEGIONARY opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.

Whenever an opératif ennemi performs the Repli action while dans la portée de contrôle of this opératif, you can use this rule.
If you do, roll one D6: on a 3+, that opératif ennemi cannot perform that action during that activation/contre-attaque (the AP spent on it is refunded).

Friendly LEGIONARY opératifs have an additional rule determined by this keyword. In addition, LEGIONARY ploys have additional benefits for opératifs with the relevant keyword.
After this opératif fights or retaliates, if it is not hors de combat, but it hors de combat an opératif ennemi during that sequence, it regains D3+1 lost wounds.

Once per battle, when this opératif is activated, you can use this rule. If you do, until the end of the battle:  - This opératif cannot perform the Ramasser un Marqueur or mission actions (excluding Operate Hatch). If it's carrying a marker, it must immediately perform the Placer un Marqueur action for 0AP (this takes precedence over all other rules). - Normal and Critical Dmg of 4 or more inflicts 1 less damage on this opératif.  
If this opératif has the NURGLE keyword, you cannot reduce the damage of an dés d'attaque by more than 1. In other words, you cannot use both rules to reduce Normal Dmg of 4 or more by 2. - Its daemonic claw has the Ceaseless and Lethal 5+ weapon rules.

Each friendly LEGIONARY opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.

In the Ready step of each Strategy phase, if this opératif controls an objective marker that isn't tainted, that objective marker is tainted for the battle and you gain 1CP. Note that if any opératif (including opératifs ennemis) has tainted an objective marker, you cannot taint that objective marker.
Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this opératif's APL stat as 1 higher. Note this is not a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.

If it is two Tirer actions, a bolt pistol, boltgun or tainted bolt pistol must be selected for at least one of them.  

Each friendly LEGIONARY opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.

Whenever this opératif incapacitates an opératif ennemi while fighting or retaliating, select one other opératif ennemi visible to and within 3" of either this opératif or the hors de combat enemy
opératif. Subtract 1 from that opératif ennemi's APL stat until the end of its next activation.

Whenever you select a LEGIONARY opératif for the battle, you must select one of the following keywords for it to have for that battle: KHORNE, NURGLE, SLAANESH, TZEENTCH, UNDIVIDED.
Each opératif's keyword can be different, but a BALEFIRE ACOLYTE opératif cannot have the KHORNE keyword.  

Friendly LEGIONARY opératifs have an additional rule determined by this keyword. In addition, LEGIONARY ploys have additional benefits for opératifs with the relevant keyword.
Whenever this opératif is retaliating, you resolve the first dés d'attaque (i.e. defender instead of attacker).

Place your Grisly marker within this opératif's portée de contrôle.

- Whenever an opératif ennemi is within 3" of your Grisly marker, your opponent must spend 1 additional AP for that opératif ennemi to perform the Ramasser un Marqueur and mission actions.
- Whenever determining control of a marker, treat the total APL stat of opératifs ennemis that contest it as 1 lower if at least one of those opératifs ennemis is within 3" of your Grisly marker.
Note this is not a change to the APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

ploys.description: Whenever a friendly LEGIONARY opératif (excluding KHORNE) is fighting, the first time you strike during that sequence, inflict 1 additional damage (to a maximum of 7).    Add 1 to both Dmg stats of friendly LEGIONARY KHORNE opératifs' melee weapons (to a maximum of 7).

Whenever a friendly LEGIONARY opératif is shooting a ready opératif ennemi, that opératif allié's ranged weapons have the Balanced weapon rule.   
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a ready friendly LEGIONARY TZEENTCH opératif, in the Roll dés de défense step, if you retain any succès critiques, you can retain one of your fails as a succès normal instead of discarding it.   
 
**Balanced:** Can re-roll one Attack die.

Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly LEGIONARY opératif, weapons with the Piercing 1 weapon rule have the Piercing Crits 1 weapon rule instead.

You can ignore any changes to the stats of friendly LEGIONARY NURGLE opératifs from being injured (including their weapons' stats).

Whenever a friendly LEGIONARY opératif that performed an action in which it moved during this point tournant is fighting, worsen the Hit stat of the opératif ennemi's melee weapons by 1.  
 Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly LEGIONARY SLAANESH opératif more than 6" from it that performed an action in which it moved during this point tournant, worsen the Hit stat of the opératif ennemi's weapons by 1.  
 In all cases for this ploy, this is not cumulative with being injured.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly LEGIONARY NURGLE opératif is performing the Tirer action, when you select a valid target.
Until the end of that action, whenever that opératif allié is shooting an opératif ennemi within 3" of it (i.e. including secondary targets, if any),
that opératif allié's ranged weapons have the Piercing 1 weapon rule.  

**Piercing 1:** The defender collects 1 less Defence die.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly LEGIONARY TZEENTCH opératif is activated. Until the end of that opératif's activation, add 1 to its APL stat, but it cannot perform the same action more than once during that activation.
If it's a WARRIOR opératif, that opératif's Marks of Chaos keyword cannot be changed during this point tournant (see Infernal Pact additional rule).

Use this firefight ploy during a friendly LEGIONARY SLAANESH opératif's activation, before or after it performs an action.
Select one opératif ennemi visible to and within 4" of that opératif allié. Until the end of that opératif ennemi's next activation, subtract 1 from its APL stat.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly LEGIONARY KHORNE opératif is hors de combat while fighting or retaliating.  

You can strike the opératif ennemi in that sequence with one of your unresolved successes before it's removed from the zone de combat.

equipments.description: **STRATEGIC GAMBIT** Select one friendly LEGIONARY opératif. Until the Ready step of the next Strategy phase, change that opératif's Save stat to 2+.

Friendly LEGIONARY opératifs have the following melee weapon for the battle:
|**Name**|**ATK**|**HIT**|**DMG**|
|-----|:-----:|:-----:|:-----:|
|Malefic Blade|5|3+|3/4|

Once per point tournant, when a friendly LEGIONARY opératif is performing the Tirer action and you select a bolt pistol or boltgun, you can use this rule.
If you do, until the end of that action, that weapon has the Rending weapon rule.

**STRATEGIC GAMBIT**
Select one Marks of Chaos keyword.
Once during each of their activations, when a friendly LEGIONARY opératif that has that keyword is shooting, fighting or retaliating, if you roll two or more fails,
you can inflict D3 damage on that opératif allié to discard one of them and retain the other as a succès normal instead.
Note that if it is the Tirer action and that damage incapacitates that opératif allié, the action does not end (continue the sequence with your successful dés d'attaque).

description:
The Mandrakes can be found in Aelindrach, a region of Commorragh. Literally fallen into shadow, it is one of the several districts of Commorragh that exists in more than one dimension at once. In Aelindrach, shadows thicken and writhe as living things, flowing into one another and attempting to capture those that venture into the district.
  
  

It is in Aelindrach that Mandrakes and Shaderavens make their lairs. Rumour has it that somewhere in Aelindrach lies a portal to a world where shade-daemons exist who can freeze the soul with but a touch.
composition:
A MANDRAKE killteam is composed of:

- 1 MANDRAKE Nightfiend
- 8 MANDRAKE opératifs selected from the following list:  
  - Abyssal
  - Chooser of the Flesh
  - Dirgemaw
  - Shadeweaver
  - Warrior

Other than Warrior opératifs, your Killteam can only include each opératif once.

opTypes.keywords: MANDRAKE, AELDARI, DRUKHARI, LEADER, NIGHTFIEND

abilities.description: Whenever your opponent would activate an opératif ennemi within 6" of this opératif, you can roll one die (you cannot do so if you also interrupted that opératif's activation with the DIRGEMAW opératif's Haunting Focus additional rule during this point tournant). If the result is higher than the opératif ennemi's APL stat, they cannot activate it during this activation. If there are no other opératifs ennemis eligible to be activated, this rule has no effect.

Whenever this opératif is readied, or if this opératif incapacitates an enemy with its huskblade, its Oubliex becomes active.
Whenever its oubliex is active and an dés d'attaque would inflict damage on this opératif, you can roll one d6, on a 5+ ignore the damage inflicted from that dés d'attaque and the oubliex is no longer active.

Once per point tournant, one friendly MANDRAKE opératif WITHIN SHADOW can use a SHADOW PASSAGE when it performs the Repositionner action. If it does, do not move it. Instead, remove it from the zone de combat and set it back up WITHIN SHADOW. When you set it back up it cannot:  - Be dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi. - Be a valid target for an opératif ennemi. - Perform the Tirer or Combattre action until the start of the next point tournant.
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly MANDRAKE opératif, ignore the Piercing weapon rule. Whenever a friendly MANDRAKE opératif is WITHIN SHADOW, improve its Save stat by 1.

Un opératif is WITHIN SHADOW if any of the following are true:

- It is within 1" of Heavy Terrain that is not lower than it.
- Any part of its base is underneath Vantage terrain.
- A Shadow Portal marker is within its portée de contrôle (See SHADEWEAVER opératif).

opTypes.keywords: MANDRAKE, AELDARI, DRUKHARI, CHOOSER OF THE FLESH

abilities.description: Whenever an opératif ennemi performs the Repli action while dans la portée de contrôle of this opératif, you can use this rule. If you do, inflict 2D3 damage on that opératif ennemi before it moves.

Whenever an opératif ennemi is hors de combat as a result of this opératif's Part Collector rule or Baleblade, you gain 1 Soul Harvest point, or 2 if the opératif ennemi had an APL stat of 3 or more.
Whenever a friendly MANDRAKE opératif is activated, you can spend 1 of your Soul Harvest points to either add 1 to its APL stat until the end of the battle, or to have it regain 2D3 lost wounds.
Note you can spend your Soul Harvest points even if this opératif is hors de combat.

Once per point tournant, one friendly MANDRAKE opératif WITHIN SHADOW can use a SHADOW PASSAGE when it performs the Repositionner action. If it does, do not move it. Instead, remove it from the zone de combat and set it back up WITHIN SHADOW. When you set it back up it cannot:  - Be dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi. - Be a valid target for an opératif ennemi. - Perform the Tirer or Combattre action until the start of the next point tournant.
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly MANDRAKE opératif, ignore the Piercing weapon rule. Whenever a friendly MANDRAKE opératif is WITHIN SHADOW, improve its Save stat by 1.

Un opératif is WITHIN SHADOW if any of the following are true:

- It is within 1" of Heavy Terrain that is not lower than it.
- Any part of its base is underneath Vantage terrain.
- A Shadow Portal marker is within its portée de contrôle (See SHADEWEAVER opératif).

opTypes.keywords: MANDRAKE, AELDARI, DRUKHARI, ABYSSAL

abilities.description:
Whenever a friendly MANDRAKE opératif is shooting an opératif ennemi that has one of your Balefire tokens add 1 to both DMG stats of that opératif allié's ranged weapons and they have the Saturate weapon rule.
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly MANDRAKE opératif that has one of your Balefire tokens, subtract 1 from both DMG stats of that opératif's ranged weapons (to a minimum of 1).

Once per point tournant, one friendly MANDRAKE opératif WITHIN SHADOW can use a SHADOW PASSAGE when it performs the Repositionner action. If it does, do not move it. Instead, remove it from the zone de combat and set it back up WITHIN SHADOW. When you set it back up it cannot:  - Be dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi. - Be a valid target for an opératif ennemi. - Perform the Tirer or Combattre action until the start of the next point tournant.
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly MANDRAKE opératif, ignore the Piercing weapon rule. Whenever a friendly MANDRAKE opératif is WITHIN SHADOW, improve its Save stat by 1.

Un opératif is WITHIN SHADOW if any of the following are true:

- It is within 1" of Heavy Terrain that is not lower than it.
- Any part of its base is underneath Vantage terrain.
- A Shadow Portal marker is within its portée de contrôle (See SHADEWEAVER opératif).

Select one opératif visible to this opératif that does not have one of your Balefire tokens.
Until the start of this opératif's next activation, until it is hors de combat, or until it performs this action again (Whichever comes first), that selected opératif gains one of your Balefire tokens.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

opTypes.keywords: MANDRAKE, AELDARI, DRUKHARI, DIRGEMAW

abilities.description: Select one opératif ennemi. Until the ready step of the next strategy phase, it gains your Haunting Focus token. The next time your opponent would activate an opératif ennemi that has your Haunting Focus token, if this opératif is ready, you can activate this opératif first (you cannot do so if you also rolled to prevent that opératif's activation with the NIGHTFIEND opératif's Harrowing Whispers additional rule during this point tournant). If you do, during that activation, this opératif must Combattre against or Tirer against that opératif ennemi, and cannot do so against any other opératifs ennemis until it does (if this is not possible, the activation is cancelled). After completing this opératif's activation, your opponent activates that opératif ennemi (if possible), or activates a different opératif ennemi if they can't.

Once per point tournant, one friendly MANDRAKE opératif WITHIN SHADOW can use a SHADOW PASSAGE when it performs the Repositionner action. If it does, do not move it. Instead, remove it from the zone de combat and set it back up WITHIN SHADOW. When you set it back up it cannot:  - Be dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi. - Be a valid target for an opératif ennemi. - Perform the Tirer or Combattre action until the start of the next point tournant.
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly MANDRAKE opératif, ignore the Piercing weapon rule. Whenever a friendly MANDRAKE opératif is WITHIN SHADOW, improve its Save stat by 1.

Un opératif is WITHIN SHADOW if any of the following are true:

- It is within 1" of Heavy Terrain that is not lower than it.
- Any part of its base is underneath Vantage terrain.
- A Shadow Portal marker is within its portée de contrôle (See SHADEWEAVER opératif).

Select one opératif ennemi that is a valid target for this opératif or is WITHIN SHADOW.
Until the start of this opératif's next activation, until it is hors de combat, or until it performs this action again (whichever comes first),
worsen the HIT stat of that opératif ennemi's weapons by 1 and subtract 2" from its Move stat (these are not cumulative with being injured).
In addition, that opératif ennemi's APL stat cannot be added to (remove all positive APL stat changes it has).

opTypes.keywords: MANDRAKE, AELDARI, DRUKHARI, SHADEWEAVER

abilities.description: Once per point tournant, one friendly MANDRAKE opératif WITHIN SHADOW can use a SHADOW PASSAGE when it performs the Repositionner action. If it does, do not move it. Instead, remove it from the zone de combat and set it back up WITHIN SHADOW. When you set it back up it cannot:  - Be dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi. - Be a valid target for an opératif ennemi. - Perform the Tirer or Combattre action until the start of the next point tournant.

Whenever this opératif performs the Repositionner action using a SHADOW PASSAGE, you can use this rule.
If you do so, remove your Shadow Portal markers from the zone de combat (if any), then place one of your Shadow Portal markers within this opératif's portée de contrôle before it is removed
and one within its portée de contrôle after it is set up.  

Each friendly MANDRAKE opératif can use a SHADOW PASSAGE each point tournant (taking precedence over one opératif once per point tournant)
if one of your Shadow Portal markers is within that opératif's portée de contrôle when it is removed, and the other when it is set up.
Note that opératifs alliés can do this even if this opératif has been hors de combat, and doing so does not prevent the opératif from using a SHADOW PASSAGE in the normal manner.
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly MANDRAKE opératif, ignore the Piercing weapon rule. Whenever a friendly MANDRAKE opératif is WITHIN SHADOW, improve its Save stat by 1.

Un opératif is WITHIN SHADOW if any of the following are true:

- It is within 1" of Heavy Terrain that is not lower than it.
- Any part of its base is underneath Vantage terrain.
- A Shadow Portal marker is within its portée de contrôle (See SHADEWEAVER opératif).

Remove your Weave Darkness marker from the zone de combat (if any).
Then place your Weave Darkness marker visible to this opératif, or on vantage terrain of a feature visible to this opératif.
That marker creates an area of smoke with the same size and effects of a smoke grenade, except you do not remove it during the following point tournant.
If this opératif is hors de combat, remove your Weave Darkness marker from the zone de combat.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

opTypes.keywords: MANDRAKE, AELDARI, DRUKHARI, WARRIOR

abilities.description: Once per point tournant, one friendly MANDRAKE opératif WITHIN SHADOW can use a SHADOW PASSAGE when it performs the Repositionner action. If it does, do not move it. Instead, remove it from the zone de combat and set it back up WITHIN SHADOW. When you set it back up it cannot:  - Be dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi. - Be a valid target for an opératif ennemi. - Perform the Tirer or Combattre action until the start of the next point tournant.
Whenever this opératif is WITHIN SHADOW, add 1 to the critical damage stat of its Glimmersteel Blade.
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly MANDRAKE opératif, ignore the Piercing weapon rule. Whenever a friendly MANDRAKE opératif is WITHIN SHADOW, improve its Save stat by 1.

Un opératif is WITHIN SHADOW if any of the following are true:

- It is within 1" of Heavy Terrain that is not lower than it.
- Any part of its base is underneath Vantage terrain.
- A Shadow Portal marker is within its portée de contrôle (See SHADEWEAVER opératif).

ploys.description: Each friendly MANDRAKE opératif can perform the Charge action while it has a Conceal order if it starts or ends that action WITHIN SHADOW.

After each opératif ennemi's activation, before the next opératif is activated, you can perform a free Ruée action with one friendly MANDRAKE opératif that has a Conceal order if it starts and ends that action WITHIN SHADOW.
You cannot use this ploy during the first point tournant, and each opératif allié can only be selected for this ploy once per point tournant.

Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly MANDRAKE opératif that is WITHIN SHADOW, you can retain one of your dés de défense as a succès normal without rolling it (In addition to a cover save, if any).
Whenever a friendly MANDRAKE opératif is shooting, fighting or retaliating, if it is WITHIN SHADOW you can re-roll one of your dés d'attaque.

Use this firefight ploy during a friendly MANDRAKE opératif's activation, when it performs an action in which it moves. Until the end of that activation, that opératif can move through parts of terrain features as if they were not there, but must end those moves in a location it can be placed.

Use this firefight ploy when an opératif ennemi performs the Combattre action in an activation in which it has performed the Charge action,
and selects a friendly MANDRAKE opératif WITHIN SHADOW to Combattre against.
In the Resolve dés d'attaque step of that sequence, you resolve the first dés d'attaque (i.e, defender instead of attacker).

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly MANDRAKE opératif is shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against an opératif ennemi within 6" of it, at the end of the Resolve dés d'attaque Step.
That opératif allié regains a number of lost wounds equal to that opératif ennemi's APL stat, multiplied by the number of your dés d'attaque that inflicted damage during that sequence.
Excess dés d'attaque are ignore (i.e, if the opératif ennemi is hors de combat before remaining dés d'attaque are resolved).  

You cannot use this ploy if that friendly MANDRAKE opératif is hors de combat.

Use this firefight ploy at the end of any opératif's activation.
Select one friendly MANDRAKE opératif that has an Engage order and is WITHIN SHADOW.
Change that opératif's order to Conceal.

equipments.description:
Once per point tournant, a friendly MANDRAKE opératif can use the following ranged weapon:

|**Name**|**ATK**|**HIT**|**DMG**|
|-----|:-----:|:-----:|:-----:|
|Bone Dart|4|3+|2/4|
|**Weapon Rules**|
|Range 6", Rending, Silent|

Whenever an opératif ennemi would perform the Repli action while dans la portée de contrôle of a friendly MANDRAKE opératif,
if no other opératifs ennemis are within that opératif allié's portée de contrôle, you can use this rule.
If you do, roll 2D6, or 1D6 if that opératif ennemi has a higher Wounds stat than that opératif allié.
If any result is a 4+, that enemy cannot perform that action during that activation or contre-attaque (No AP are spent on it).

Once per point tournant, when a friendly MANDRAKE opératif is activated WITHIN SHADOW, you can use this rule. If you do, until the start of its next activation, while that opératif has a Conceal order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g, Seek, Vantage Point) except being within 2".

Once per point tournant, when a friendly MANDRAKE opératif is performing the Tirer action and you select a Baleblast, you can use this rule.
If you do, until the end of that action, that weapon has the Blast 1" rule.

description:
The Night Lords are synonymous with terror and murder, for their favoured mode of warfare is the unfettered application of brutal, overwhelming force. They show no mercy whatsoever, eschewing all subtlety and guile for wanton bloodshed and destruction.
  
  

The Night Lords do not worship any of the four major Chaos Gods individually, but acknowledge them equally in the form of Chaos Undivided as they ruthlessly spread terror and fear amongst the galaxy's inhabitants. The Night Lords are experts in the use of terror tactics to win battles and demoralise their foes before the main combat even begins.
composition:
A NEMESIS CLAW KillTeam is composed of:

- 1 NEMESIS CLAW Visionary with one of the following options:
  - Bolt pistol, power fist
  - Bolt pistol, power maul
  - Bolt pistol, power weapon
  - Plasma Pistol, Nostraman Chainblade
- 5 Nemesis Claw opératifs selected from the following list:
  - Fearmonger
  - Gunner with one of the following options:
    - Bolt Pistol, Flamer, Fists
      - Bolt Pistol, Meltagun, Fists
      - Bolt Pistol, Plasma Gun, Fists   
  - Heavy Gunner with one of the following options:
    - Bolt Pistol, Heavy Bolter, Fists
    - Bolt Pistol, Missile Launcher, Fists    
  - Screecher
  - Skinthief
  - Ventrilokar
  - Warrior with one of the following options:
    - Bolt pistol, Chainsword
    - Boltgun, Fists

opTypes.keywords: NEMESIS CLAW, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, LEADER, PSYKER, VISIONARY

abilities.description:
During each friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif's activation, it can perform either 2 Tirer actions or 2 Combattre actions.
If it is 2 Tirer actions, a bolt pistol, boltgun or scoped bolt pistol must be selected for at least one of them.
Each friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.

Whenever an opératif ennemi is shooting a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif, that opératif allié is obscured if both of the following are true:  - It is more than 8" from opératifs ennemis it is visible to. - It has Heavy Terrain within its portée de contrôle, or any part of its base is underneath Vantage terrain.

*PSYCHIC*    In the ready step of each Strategy phase, you gain 1D3 Prescience points. At the end of each point tournant, discard your Prescience points. You can spend your Prescience points in the Firefight phase as follows (you cannot use each of the following rules more than once per point tournant).  - Foreboding: *PSYCHIC* Whenever it is your turn to activate a opératif allié, you can spend 1 of your Prescience points to skip that activation. - Portent: *PSYCHIC* Whenever an dés d'attaque inflicts normal damage on this opératif, you can spend 1 of your Prescience points to ignore that inflicted damage.  You cannot gain or spend your Prescience points if this opératif is hors de combat.

*PSYCHIC* Spend 1 of your Prescience points to gain 1CP.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi, or during an activation in which it performed the Charge or Repli action (or vice-versa).

opTypes.keywords: NEMESIS CLAW, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, FEARMONGER

Whenever Un opératif that has one of your Terrorchem tokens is activated, inflict 1D3 damage on it.

Select one objective marker this opératif controls to gain one of your Terrorchem tokens.
It cannot be an objective marker dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi, or one that already has one of your Terrorchem tokens.
The first time that objective marker is dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi that does not have one of your Terrorchem tokens, that opératif gains that Terrorchem token, then inflicts 2D3 damage on it
(if it is during an action, at the end of that action).

abilities.description:
During each friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif's activation, it can perform either 2 Tirer actions or 2 Combattre actions.
If it is 2 Tirer actions, a bolt pistol, boltgun or scoped bolt pistol must be selected for at least one of them.
Each friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.

Once per point tournant, when this opératif incapacitates an opératif ennemi within its portée de contrôle, you can select one other opératif ennemi visible to and within 6" of either this opératif or the hors de combat opératif.
Until the start of the next point tournant, that other opératif ennemi cannot control markers or perform the Ramasser un Marqueur or mission actions.

Whenever an opératif ennemi is shooting a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif, that opératif allié is obscured if both of the following are true:  - It is more than 8" from opératifs ennemis it is visible to. - It has Heavy Terrain within its portée de contrôle, or any part of its base is underneath Vantage terrain.
Whenever this opératif is fighting or retaliating, Normal and Critical damage of 3 or more inflicts 1 less damage on it.

opTypes.keywords: NEMESIS CLAW, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, VENTRILOKAR

abilities.description:
During each friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif's activation, it can perform either 2 Tirer actions or 2 Combattre actions.
If it is 2 Tirer actions, a bolt pistol, boltgun or scoped bolt pistol must be selected for at least one of them.
Each friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.
Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this opératif's APL stat as 1 higher. Note this is not a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.

Whenever an opératif ennemi is shooting a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif, that opératif allié is obscured if both of the following are true:  - It is more than 8" from opératifs ennemis it is visible to. - It has Heavy Terrain within its portée de contrôle, or any part of its base is underneath Vantage terrain.

*PSYCHIC*  

Select one opératif ennemi within 6" of this opératif, then select one of the following for that opératif ennemi (you can only select each option once per battle):

- Until the end of the next activation, subtract 1 from its APL stat
- Change its order
- Perform a free Ruée with it (specify the location for your opponent to move it to)

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

opTypes.keywords: NEMESIS CLAW, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, WARRIOR

abilities.description:
During each friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif's activation, it can perform either 2 Tirer actions or 2 Combattre actions.
If it is 2 Tirer actions, a bolt pistol, boltgun or scoped bolt pistol must be selected for at least one of them.
Each friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.

Whenever this opératif is shooting against, fighting against, or retaliating against an injured opératif ennemi, or an opératif ennemi that has a wounds stat of 7 or less, its weapons have the Lethal 5+ rule.

Whenever an opératif ennemi is shooting a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif, that opératif allié is obscured if both of the following are true:  - It is more than 8" from opératifs ennemis it is visible to. - It has Heavy Terrain within its portée de contrôle, or any part of its base is underneath Vantage terrain.

ploys.description:
Whenever you are selecting a valid target for a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif, opératifs ennemis within 6" cannot use Light terrain for cover.
While this can allow such opératifs to be targeted (assuming they are visible), it does not remove their cover save (if any).

One friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif can immediately perform a free Repli or Repositionner action, but it must end that move with Heavy terrain within its portée de contrôle, or any part of its base underneath Vantage terrain. In addition, it cannot move more than 4" during that action and it cannot end that move closer to opératifs ennemis (in a zone de combat that uses the close quarters rules, e.g. zone de combat: Gallowdark, ignore Wall terrain when determining this).
Whenever a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif is shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against a wounded opératif ennemi, you can re-roll one of your dés d'attaque.

Whenever a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif is activated, if the first action it performs during that activation is the Charge action, when it ends its move during that action, you can inflict D3 damage on one opératif ennemi within its portée de contrôle.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif is retaliating, at the start of the Resolve dés d'attaque step.
You can resolve one of your successes before the normal order. If you do you cannot resolve any other successes during that sequence.

Use this firefight ploy after rolling your dés d'attaque for a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif, if it's shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against an opératif ennemi that has the IMPERIUM keyword. That opératif allié's weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule until the end of the sequence; if that opératif ennemi also has the Adeptus Astartes keyword, that opératif allié's weapons have the Relentless weapon rule until the end of that sequence instead.  
**Ceaseless:** Can re-roll any or all results of one value (e.g. all results of 2)  
**Relentless:** Can re-roll any or all dés d'attaque.

Use this firefight ploy after a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif incapacitates an opératif ennemi whin its portée de contrôle.
That opératif allié can immediately perform a free Charge or Ruée action (for the former, it cannot move more than 3") even if it has performed an action that prevents it from performing the Charge or Ruée action.

Use this firefight ploy when your opponent would activate an opératif ennemi that's visible to a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif. Roll one D6; if the result is higher than that opératif ennemi's APL stat, your opponent cannot activate it during this activation; if the result is less than or equal to that opératif ennemi's APL stat, this ploy isn't used, the CP spent on it is refunded and you cannot use this ploy again during this point tournant. If there are no other opératifs ennemis eligible to be activated, this ploy has no effect.

equipments.description:
Whenever an opératif ennemi would perform the Repli action while dans la portée de contrôle of a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif, if no other opératifs ennemis are within that opératif allié's portée de contrôle, you can use this rule.
If you do, roll 2D6, or 1D6 if that opératif ennemi has a higher Wounds stat than that opératif allié.
If any result is a 4+, that opératif ennemi cannot perform that action during that activation or contre-attaque (No AP are spent on it).

Whenever an opératif ennemi is within 3" of a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif, that opératif ennemi's APL stat cannot be added to. Note that this does not affect APL stats that have already been changed.

Whenever an opératif ennemi is shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif within 2" of it, your opponent cannot re-roll their dés d'attaque results of 1.

Once per Battle, when a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif incapacitates an opératif ennemi within 2" of it, you can use this rule.
If you do, that opératif allié gains one of your Grisly Trophy tokens (if it does not already have one).
Whenever a friendly NEMESIS CLAW opératif that has one of your Grisly Trophy tokens is visible to and within 2" of an opératif ennemi, subtract 1 from the ATK stat of that opératif ennemi's weapons.

description: Non-player opératifs for joint operations in KT2024.

abilities.description:
When activated, if this NPO can perform either of its first two actions during that activation, give it an Engage order. If it cannot, give it a Conceal order.

- Combattre
- Charge the closest opératif ennemi via the shortest possible route
- Repositionner toward the closest opératif ennemi, to cover if possible (a subsequent Ruée action can fulfil this, if able)
- Ruée towards the closest opératif ennemi, to cover if possible

- Repositionner toward the closest opératif ennemi, to cover if possible (a subsequent Ruée action can fulfil this, if able)

This opératif cannot move, have an Engage order, be readied or be activated. Whenever an NPO would activate, if this opératif has reloaded (see below) and there's a valid target for it, perform the Tirer action with this opératif instead of activating an NPO, then it has no longer reloaded.

In the Ready step of each Strategy phase, this opératif has reloaded. Each time after this opératif performs the Tirer action, roll one D6: after a number of player opératifs have been activated this point tournant equal to the result, this opératif has reloaded.

Whenever this opératif is shooting, opératifs cannot be obscured. Whenever determining visibility from this opératif (but not to it), the line can also be drawn from any part of the Vantage terrain it's on, or the rampart touching that Vantage terrain.

description:
New inductees into the ranks of the Adepta Sororitas, Sisters Novitiate who display great zeal and determination are
often deployed together in kill teams to hunt down apostates or root out heretics. In performing such duties, they may one day rise to become full Sisters, spreading the Emperor's light ever further.
composition:
A NOVITIATES killteam is composed of:

- 1 NOVITIATE SUPERIOR opératif with one of the following options:
  - Plasma pistol; power weapon
  - Relic boltgun; gun butt
  - Relic bolt pistol; power weapon
- 9 NOVITIATE opératifs selected from the following list:
  - CONDEMNOR
  - DIALOGUS
  - DUELLIST
  - EXACTOR
  - HOSPITALLER
  - PENITENT
  - PRECEPTOR
  - PRONATUS
  - PURGATUS
  - RELIQUARIUS
  - MILITANT with one of the following options:
    - Autopistol; Novitiate blade
    - Autogun; gun butt

Other than MILITANT and PURGATUS opératifs, your kill team can only include each opératif on this list once.  

Your kill team can only include up to two PURGATUS opératifs.

opTypes.keywords: NOVITIATE, IMPERIUM, ADEPTA SORORITAS, LEADER, SUPERIOR

abilities.description:
In the Ready step of each Strategy phase, you gain a number of Faith points equal to half the number of friendly NOVITIATE opératifs that have not been hors de combat (rounding up).
Whenever a friendly NOVITIATE opératif is shooting, fighting or retaliating, or Un opératif is shooting it, in the Roll dés d'attaque (or Roll dés de défense step if Un opératif is shooting it),
you can spend your Faith points to use one ACT OF FAITH.  

You cannot use more than one ACT OF FAITH per sequence, and their costs and effects are as follows:  


- **GUIDANCE - 1 FAITH POINT**  
You can re-roll one of your dice.
- **BLESSING - 2 FAITH POINTS**  
 You can retain one of your succès normaux as a succès critique instead.
- **INTERVENTION - 3 FAITH POINTS**  
You can retain one of your fails as a succès normal instead of discarding it.

Whenever this opératif incapacitates an opératif ennemi, you gain 1 Faith point, or 2 Faith points if that opératif ennemi had a Wounds stat of 12 or more.
This rule has no effect when using the Glorious Martyrdom firefight ploy.

PSYCHIC ranged weapons cannot inflict damage on this opératif.
For the effects of PSYCHIC actions, this opératif cannot be selected and is never treated as being within those actions' required distances.
Whenever Un opératif is within 6" of this opératif:

- That opératif cannot perform PSYCHIC actions or use PSYCHIC additional rules.
- That opératif cannot use PSYCHIC ranged weapons.
- PSYCHIC melee weapons have no weapon rules and cannot have Dmg stats higher than 3/4.

If your Auto-broadcaster marker isn't in the zone de combat, place it within 8" horizontally of this opératif; otherwise, move your Auto-broadcaster marker up to 8" horizontally.
If this opératif is removed from the zone de combat, remove your Auto-broadcaster marker from the zone de combat.  

Whenever an opératif ennemi within 3" of your Auto-broadcaster marker is shooting, fighting or retaliating, your opponent cannot re-roll their dés d'attaque.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

**SUPPORT**
Select one other friendly NOVITIATE opératif visible to and within 6" of this opératif, or within 6" of your Auto-broadcaster marker.
Until the end of that opératif's next activation, add 1 to its APL stat (to a maximum of 3 after all APL stat changes have been totalled).  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

After that action, that opératif allié can immediately perform a free Ruée action, but must end that move within this opératif's portée de contrôle. Subtract 1 from this and that opératif's APL stats until the end of their next activations respectively, and if this rule was used during that opératif allié's activation, that activation ends. You cannot use this rule if this opératif is hors de combat, or if it is a Tirer action and this opératif would be a primary or secondary target.

Select one friendly NOVITIATE opératif within this opératif's portée de contrôle to regain up to 2D3 lost wounds. It cannot be Un opératif that the Medic! rule was used on during this point tournant.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

If this opératif is benefitting from the effects of the Whip Into Frenzy action (see EXACTOR), this applies to each of the Combattre actions from those effects.

 You can retain one of your succès normaux as a succès critique instead.

abilities.description:
In the Ready step of each Strategy phase, you gain a number of Faith points equal to half the number of friendly NOVITIATE opératifs that have not been hors de combat (rounding up).
Whenever a friendly NOVITIATE opératif is shooting, fighting or retaliating, or Un opératif is shooting it, in the Roll dés d'attaque (or Roll dés de défense step if Un opératif is shooting it),
you can spend your Faith points to use one ACT OF FAITH.

- **GUIDANCE - 1 FAITH POINT**  
You can re-roll one of your dice.
- **BLESSING - 2 FAITH POINTS**  
 You can retain one of your succès normaux as a succès critique instead.
- **INTERVENTION - 3 FAITH POINTS**  
You can retain one of your fails as a succès normal instead of discarding it.
Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this opératif's APL stat as 1 higher. Note this isn't a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.

You gain 1 Faith point. If this opératif controls an objective marker, you also gain a number of Faith points equal to the point tournant number.  

This opératif can only perform this action once per point tournant, and cannot perform it while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

ploys.description:
Whenever a friendly NOVITIATE opératif is shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against an expended opératif ennemi, that opératif allié's weapons have the Punishing weapon rule.  
**Punishing:** If you retain any succès critiques, you can retain one of your fails as a succès normal instead of discarding it.

Whenever you spend Faith points, at the end of that action, the opératif allié you spent them oncan regain up to D3 lost Wounds. Note this ploy has no effect if the ACT OF FAITH doesn't cost any Faith points, e.g. Auto-chastisers equipment.

Whenever Un opératif is shooting against, fighting against or retaliating against a friendly NOVITIATE opératif that contests an objective marker, in the Resolve dés d'attaque step of that sequence, you can halve the damage inflicted (rounding up and to a minimum of 2) on that opératif allié from one succès normal.

Up to one third of the friendly NOVITIATE opératifs in the zone de combat (rounding down, to a minimum of 1) can immediately perform a free Ruée action in an order of your choice,
but each that does so must end that move closer to its closest opératif ennemi, its closest objective marker or your opponent's drop zone (you can choose separately for each).  

You cannot use this ploy during the first point tournant.

Use this firefight ploy when an opératif ennemi is performing the Tirer action and selects a friendly NOVITIATE opératif as the valid target.
Until the end of that activation/contre-attaque, while that opératif allié is more than 2" from that opératif ennemi, your opponent cannot select it as a valid target.
If there are no other valid targets that your opponent can select, that action ends (it's not cancelled, so that opératif has still performed it).
Note this ploy has no effect if it's not the selected opératif, e.g. if it's a secondary target from the Blast weapon rule.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly NOVITIATE opératif is shooting with a Ministorum flamer and you inflict damage with any succès critiques. The target gains one of your Blaze tokens (if it doesn't already have one). Whenever Un opératif that has one of your Blaze tokens is activated:  - Inflict D3 damage on it. - Its controlling player can subtract 1 from that opératif's APL stat until the end of that activation to remove that token. Note that this must be done before that opératif performs any actions during that activation.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly NOVITIATE opératif is performing the Tirer action and you're selecting a ranged weapon.
Until the end of that action, whenever that opératif is shooting Un opératif within 6" of it, that weapon has the Seek Light weapon rule.  

**Seek Light:** When selecting a valid target, opératifs cannot use light terrain for cover. While this can allow such opératifs to be targeted (assuming they are Visible), it does not remove their Cover save (if any).

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly NOVITIATE opératif is hors de combat, before it is removed from the zone de combat. For each opératif ennemi visible to and within 2" of it, you gain 1 Faith point and inflict D3 damage on that opératif ennemi (roll separately for each).

equipments.description: Once per point tournant, you can use up to two ACTS OF FAITH during a sequence, but each one must be different. This takes precedence over the normal ACTS OF FAITH rules.

Whenever a friendly NOVITIATE opératif is shooting with an autogun, autopistol, relic bolt pistol or relic boltgun, if you spend a Faith point, that weapon has the Piercing Crits 1 weapon rule until the end of that sequence.

Once per point tournant, when a friendly NOVITIATE opératif is shooting, fighting or retaliating, in the Roll dés d'attaque step,
you can inflict 1-3 damage on that opératif allié (but not enough to incapacitate it).
If you do, you can use one ACT OF FAITH for free during that sequence with a Faith points cost no more than the damage you inflicted from this rule.
You can ignore any changes to the Move stat of friendly NOVITIATE opératifs from being injured.

description:
Specialist reconnaissance infantry, T'au Pathfinders range far ahead of their allies. Pathfinder kill teams are capable
of operating independently of the main T'au force, and are equipped for almost any situation. Their advanced wargear
and potent weaponry enable them to disrupt communications, perform acts of sabotage and destroy targets.
composition:
A PATHFINDERS KillTeam is composed of:

- 1 PATHFINDER SHAS'UI opératif
- 11 PATHFINDER opératifs selected from the following list:
  - ASSAULT GRENADIER
  - BLOODED
  - COMMS SPECIALIST
  - DRONE CONTROLLER
  - MARKSMAN
  - MEDICAL TECHNICIAN
  - SHAS'LA
  - TRANSPECTRAL INTERFERENCE
  - MB3 Reconnaissance DRONE (counts as two selections)
  - MV31 PULSE ACCELERATOR DRONE
  - MV33 GRAV-INHIBITOR DRONE
  - MV1 GUN DRONE
  - MV4 SHIELD DRONE
  - MV7 MARKER DRONE
  - WEAPONS EXPERT with one of the following:
    - Ion rifle; gun butt
    - Rail rifle; gun butt
        
Other than SHAS'LA and WEAPONS EXPERT opératifs, your kill team can only include each opératif on this list once.  

Your kill team can only include up to two WEAPONS EXPERT opératifs.  

Some PATHFINDER rules refer to a 'pulse weapon'. The following weapons are pulse weapons: burst cannon, pulse carbine, suppressed pulse carbine, twin pulse carbine.

opTypes.keywords: PATHFINDER, T'AU EMPIRE, LEADER, SHAS'UI

abilities.description:
Once per battle STRATEGIC GAMBIT. Select one of the following and apply its rules until the end of the point tournant:

- Mont'ka: Add 1" to the Move stat of friendly PATHFINDER opératifs.
- Kauyon: Friendly PATHFINDER opératifs can perform a free Markerlight action during their activation if they have a Conceal order

Select one opératif ennemi visible to this opératif. That opératif ennemi gains one of your Markerlight tokens (to a maximum of four).  

Un opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.
If Un opératif (excluding MB3 Reconnaissance) would perform the Tirer action (excluding Vigilance) and this action during the same activation, only the target of that Tirer action can be selected for this action (and vice versa).

Once during each of their activations, whenever an opératif ennemi that has any of your Markerlight tokens performs the Ruée, Charge, Repli or Repositionner action, remove one of its Markerlight tokens.  

While only some PATHFINDER opératifs can perform the Markerlight action, all PATHFINDER opératifs can benefit from its effects.
Whenever a friendly PATHFINDER opératif is shooting with a weapon from its datacard (excluding ASSAULT GRENADIER'S fusion grenade), it has additional rules determined by the number of your Markerlight tokens the target has.

abilities.description:
The first time during each point tournant that another friendly PATHFINDER opératif (excluding DRONE) would be hors de combat while visible to and within 3" of this opératif, you can use this rule, providing neither this nor that opératif is dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi. If you do, that opératif allié is not hors de combat, has 1 wound remaining, and cannot be hors de combat for the remainder of that action. After that action, that opératif allié can immediately perform a free Ruée action, but must end that move within this opératif's portée de contrôle. Subtract 1 from this and that opératif's APL stats until the end of their next activations respectively, and if this rule was used during that opératif allié's activation, that activation ends.  
 You cannot use this rule if this opératif is hors de combat, or if it is a Tirer action and this opératif would be a primary or secondary target.

Select one friendly PATHFINDER opératif (excluding DRONE) within this opératif's portée de contrôle to regain up to 2D3 lost wounds.
It cannot be Un opératif that the Medic! rule was used on during this point tournant.

Once during each of their activations, whenever an opératif ennemi that has any of your Markerlight tokens performs the Ruée, Charge, Repli or Repositionner action, remove one of its Markerlight tokens.  

While only some PATHFINDER opératifs can perform the Markerlight action, all PATHFINDER opératifs can benefit from its effects.
Whenever a friendly PATHFINDER opératif is shooting with a weapon from its datacard (excluding ASSAULT GRENADIER'S fusion grenade), it has additional rules determined by the number of your Markerlight tokens the target has.
These are cumulative, so if an opératif ennemi has two of your Markerlight tokens, the opératif allié shooting it has the rules for 1 and 2 tokens during that sequence.

|**Tokens**|**Additional Rules**|
|:---:|-----|
|**1**|Saturate and Balanced weapon rules.|
|**2**|Improve the Hit stat of that opératif allié's ranged weapons by 1 (to a maximum of 3+).|
|**3**|The target cannot be obscured.|
|**4**|Seek Light weapon rule.|


**Saturate:** The defender cannot retain sauvegardes de couverture.  

**Balanced:** Can re-roll one Attack die  

**Seek Light:** When selecting a valid target, opératifs cannot use light terrain for cover. While this can allow such opératifs to be targeted (assuming they are Visible), it does not remove their Cover save (if any).

Note this isn't a change to the Move stat. - Whenever an opératif ennemi is fighting or retaliating while visible to and within 6" of this opératif, worsen the Hit stat of that opératif ennemi's melee weapons by 1. ploys.description:
Whenever a friendly PATHFINDER opératif (excluding DRONE) is shooting or retaliating with a ranged weapon (see Point-Blank Fusillade firefight ploy), if it's within 3" of another friendly PATHFINDER opératif (excluding DRONE),
that first opératif allié's ranged weapons have the Accurate 1 weapon rule.  
**Accurate 1:** You can retain 1 Attack Die as a succès normal without rolling it.

Select one zone de combat edge (excluding your own). Each friendly PATHFINDER opératif that's wholly within 6" of that edge can immediately perform a free Ruée action in an order of your choice, but each that does so must end that move wholly within 6" of a zone de combat edge (excluding your own). You cannot use this ploy during the first point tournant.

Whenever an opératif ennemi is performing the Tirer action, if the target (the primary target if the weapon has the Blast or Torrent weapon rules) isn't the closest valid target,
your opponent cannot re-roll their dés d'attaque. Ignore friendly PATHFINDER opératifs that have a Conceal order or are obscured when determining this.
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly PATHFINDER opératif, if you can retain any sauvegardes de couverture, improve that opératif allié's Save stat by 1.
Use this firefight ploy at the start of the Firefight phase. One friendly PATHFINDER opératif (excluding DRONE) can immediately perform a free mission action.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly PATHFINDER opératif (excluding DRONE) is retaliating, if it wasn't dans la portée de contrôle of opératifs ennemis at the start of that activation/contre-attaque. You can use one of its ranged weapons as a melee weapon (excluding a weapon that has the word 'grenade' in its name) during that sequence. If you do, you cannot block during that sequence, and the following weapon rules have no effect on its weapons until the end of that sequence: Devastating, Piercing, Torrent.  
If that opératif allié is ready, has an Engage order and is retaliating with a pulse weapon, you resolve the first dés d'attaque (i.e. defender instead of attacker).

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly PATHFINDER opératif is performing the Tirer action and you're selecting a valid target within 6" of it. Having other friendly PATHFINDER
opératifs within an opératif ennemi's portée de contrôle doesn't prevent that opératif ennemi from being selected.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly PATHFINDER opératif (excluding DRONE) is selected as the valid target of a Tirer action. Select one friendly PATHFINDER DRONE opératif visible to and within 3" of that first opératif allié to become the valid target instead (even if it wouldn't normally be valid for this). That friendly DRONE opératif is only in cover if the originatl target was. This ploy has no effect if the ranged weapon has the Blast or Torrent weapon rule.

equipments.description:
Once per point tournant, when a friendly PATHFINDER opératif (excluding DRONE) is performing the Tirer action and you're selecting a valid target, you can use this rule.
If you do, until the end of that action, if the target has at least one of your Markerlight tokens, it is treated as having one more. If the ranged weapon has the Blast or Torrent weapon rule, only the primary target is affected.

Once per point tournant, when a friendly PATHFINDER opératif performs the Markerlight action, you can use this rule.
If you do, you can select one opératif ennemi in the zone de combat to gain one of your Markerlight tokens instead (it doesn't need to be visible).
This is not cumulative with the high-intensity Markerlight or Analyse rules.

Once per point tournant, when a friendly PATHFINDER opératif (excluding MV7 MARKER DRONE) performs the Markerlight action, you can use this rule.
If you do, the opératif ennemi you select gains two of your Markerlight tokens (instead of one).

Once per point tournant, a friendly PATHFINDER opératif that has the Markerlight action on their datacard (excluding DRONE) can perform the following unique action:  

**PHOTON GRENADE (1 AP):**  

Select a valid target for this opératif and roll one D6:  

On a 3+, until the end of that opératif's next activation, subtract 2" from its Move stat and it cannot perform the Ruée action.</br>
Un opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

description:
Masters of stealth and subterfuge, Phobos Strike Teams consist of Marine Spatial Infiltrators, Incursors and Reivers.
Possessed of transhuman strength and equipped with a range of explosives, communications equipment and precise weaponry, they are capable of outmanoeuvring and overwhelming enemy forces many times their own size.
composition:
A PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM KillTeam is composed of:

- 1 PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif selected from the following list:
  - INFILTRATOR SERGEANT
  - INCURSOR SERGEANT
  - REIVER SERGEANT with one of the following options:
    - Special issue bolt pistol; combat knife
    - Bolt carbine; fists
- 5 PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératifs selected from the following list:
  - INFILTRATOR COMMSMAN
  - INFILTRATOR HELIX ADEPT
  - INFILTRATOR SABOTEUR
  - INFILTRATOR VETERAN
  - INFILTRATOR VOXBREAKER
  - INFILTRATOR WARRIOR
  - INCURSOR MARKSMAN
  - INCURSOR MINELAYER
  - INCURSOR WARRIOR
  - REIVER WARRIOR with one of the following options:
    - Special issue bolt pistol; combat knife
    - Bolt carbine; fists

Other than WARRIOR opératifs, your kill team can only include each opératif on this list once.

opTypes.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, LEADER, INFILTRATOR, SERGEANT

abilities.description:
During each friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif's activation, it can perform either two Tirer actions or two Combattre actions.
If it is two Tirer actions, a bolt weapon must be selected for at least one of them.
A bolt weapon is any ranged weapon that includes 'bolt' in its name, e.g. marksman bolt carbine, special issue bolt pistol, etc.  

Each friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.

**STRATEGIC GAMBIT** if a friendly INFILTRATOR opératif is in the zone de combat.
Select one opératif ennemi visible to a friendly INFILTRATOR opératif, or within 6" of a friendly VOXBREAKER opératif.
In the following Firefight phase, that opératif ennemi cannot be activated or perform actions until one of the following is true:

- Your opponent has activated a number of opératifs ennemis equal to the number of friendly INFILTRATOR opératifs in the zone de combat when this STRATEGIC GAMBIT was used.
- It is the last opératif ennemi to be activated.

You can do each of the following once per battle:

- When rolling-off to decide initiative, if this opératif is in the zone de combat, you can re-roll your dice.
- You can use a firefight ploy for 0CP if this is the specified PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif (including Command Re-roll if the attack or dés de défense was rolled for this opératif),
or the Patient Ambush firefight ploy for 0CP if this opératif is ready and not dans la portée de contrôle of opératifs ennemis.

opTypes.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, INFILTRATOR, COMMSMAN

if this opératif is in the zone de combat, you can change one strategy ploy you have used this point tournant (it does not cost you any CP to do so).

- It is the last opératif ennemi to be activated.

In the Ready step of each Strategy phase, when you gain CP, if this opératif is in the zone de combat and not dans la portée de contrôle of opératifs ennemis, you can use this rule.
If you do, roll one D6: on a 4+, you gain one additional CP.

opTypes.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, MEDIC, INFILTRATOR, HELIX ADEPT

The first time during each point tournant that another friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif would be hors de combat while visible to and within 3" of this opératif, you can use this rule, providing neither this nor that opératif is dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi. If you do, that opératif allié is not hors de combat, has 1D3 wounds remaining, and cannot be hors de combat for the remainder of that action.  
 After that action, that opératif allié can immediately perform a free Ruée action, but must end that move with this opératif's portée de contrôle. Subtract 1 from this and that opératif's APL stats until the end of their next activations respectively, and if this rule was used during that opératif allié's activation, that activation ends.  
 You cannot use this rule if this opératif is hors de combat, or if it is a Tirer action and this opératif would be a primary or secondary target.

- It is the last opératif ennemi to be activated.

Select one friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif within this opératif's portée de contrôle to regain up to 1D3+3 lost wounds.
It cannot be Un opératif that the Medic! rule was used on during this point tournant.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

It can perform the Ramasser un Marqueur action on that marker, but that marker cannot be placed within an opératif ennemi's portée de contrôle
(if this opératif is hors de combat while carrying that marker and that marker cannot be placed, it is removed with this opératif).

remove that marker, subtract 1 from that opératif's APL stat until the end of its next activation, and inflict 2D3+3 damage on it;
if it is not hors de combat, end its action (if any), even if that action's effects aren't fulfilled.
If it cannot be placed, move it the minimum amount to do so.
Note that this opératif is ignored for these effects (i.e. it cannot set it off or take damage from that marker).

Each friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.

Whenever this opératif is climbing up, you can treat the vertical distance as 2" (regardless of how far the opératif actually moves vertically). Whenever this opératif is dropping, ignore the vertical distance.

You can do each of the following once per battle:

- When rolling-off to decide initiative, if this opératif is in the zone de combat, you can re-roll your dice.
- You can use a firefight ploy for 0CP if this is the specified PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif (including Command Re-roll if the attack or dés de défense was rolled for this opératif),
or the Patient Ambush firefight ploy for 0CP if this opératif is ready and not dans la portée de contrôle of opératifs ennemis.

Whenever an opératif ennemi is within 3" of friendly REIVER opératifs, your opponent must spend 1 additional AP for that opératif ennemi to perform the Ramasser un Marqueur and mission actions.  

Whenever determining control of a marker, treat the total APL stat of opératifs ennemis that contest it as 1 lower if at least one of those opératifs ennemis is within 3" of friendly REIVER opératifs.
Note this is not a change to the APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.

opTypes.keywords: PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, REIVER, WARRIOR

During each friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif's activation, it can perform either two Tirer actions or two Combattre actions.
If it is two Tirer actions, a bolt weapon must be selected for at least one of them.
A bolt weapon is any ranged weapon that includes 'bolt' in its name, e.g. marksman bolt carbine, special issue bolt pistol, etc.  

Each friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.

Whenever this opératif is climbing up, you can treat the vertical distance as 2" (regardless of how far the opératif actually moves vertically). Whenever this opératif is dropping, ignore the vertical distance.

Whenever an opératif ennemi is within 3" of friendly REIVER opératifs, your opponent must spend 1 additional AP for that opératif ennemi to perform the Ramasser un Marqueur and mission actions.
