Once per point tournant, one friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif with this rule can perform the Ramasser un Marqueur or a mission action for 1 less AP.

ploys.ployName: And They Shall Know No Fear
ploys.description: You can ignore any changes to the stats of friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératifs from being injured (including their weapons' stats).

Whenever a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif is shooting during an activation in which it has not performed the Charge, Repli or Repositionner action, or against Un opératif that is not in cover and is more than 6" from it, that opératif allié's ranged weapons have the Balanced weapon rule.    Note that for the first requirement, that opératif is not restricted from performing those actions after shooting.   **Balanced:** Can re-roll one Attack die.

Friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératifs can perform the following unique action:  
 **Guerrila Warfare (1 AP):** Change this opératif's order.  
 Un opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

Whenever a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif is fighting, its melee weapons have the Balanced weapon rule.
If that opératif allié is doing so during an activation in which it performed the Charge action, its melee weapons also have the Lethal 5+ weapon rule.  
**Balanced:** Can re-roll one Attack die.
Use this firefight ploy when you resolve a succès critique for a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif that is shooting with a bolt weapon. Inflict D3 additional damage.
Use this firefight ploy when it is your turn to activate a opératif allié. You can skip that activation.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif that has a Conceal order is activated, is given an Engage order, performs the Charge and then the Combattre action,
and you're resolving your first dés d'attaque from this activation.
After doing so, you can immediately resolve another of your dés d'attaque (before your opponent). The opératif cannot have performed any other actions during this activation (but can do so after resolving this ploy).

Use this firefight ploy when Un opératif is shooting a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif, in the Roll dés de défense step.
You can retain one of your succès normaux as a succès critique instead.

equipments.description: Once per point tournant, when a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif is shooting, fighting or retaliating, if you roll two or more fails, you can discard one of them to retain another as a succès normal instead.

This equipment allows you to select four utility grenades from the utility grenades equipment (see universal equipment).  

You cannot also select that equipment as normal (i.e. to give you six).

Friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératifs have the following melee weapon:
 
|**Name**|**ATK**|**HIT**|**DMG**|
|-----|:-----:|:-----:|:-----:|
|Combat Blade|5|3+|3/4|

Once per point tournant, when a friendly PHOBOS STRIKE TEAM opératif is performing the Tirer action and you select a bolt carbine, marksman bolt carbine or occulus bolt carbine,
you can use this rule. If you do, until the end of the point tournant, that weapon has the Piercing 1 weapon rule.

description: Corrupted sons of Mortarion, Plague Marines are suffused and bloated with rot and disease. Though compact and slow moving, Plague Marines are horrifyingly resilient, trudging relentlessly towards their objectives while spreading contagion in their wake.
composition:
A PLAGUE MARINES KillTeam is composed of:

- 1 PLAGUE MARINE CHAMPION opératif
- 5 PLAGUE MARINE opératifs selected from the following list:
  - BOMBARDIER
  - FIGHTER
  - HEAVY GUNNER
  - ICON BEARER
  - MALIGNANT PLAGUECASTER
  - WARRIOR

Your kill team can only include each opératif on this list once

opTypes.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, LEADER, CHAMPION

abilities.description:
During each friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif's activation, it can perform either two Tirer actions or two Combattre actions.
If it is two Tirer actions, a bolt pistol, boltgun or PSYCHIC weapon must be selected for at least one of them.
You cannot select the same PSYCHIC ranged weapon more than once per activation.  

Each friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.
Whenever an dés d'attaque inflicts damage of 3 or more on a friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif, roll one D6: on a 4+, subtract 1 from that inflicted damage.

Whenever an opératif ennemi that has one of your Poison tokens loses one or more wounds within 7" of this opératif, this opératif regains up to an equal number of lost wounds (to a maximum of 3 lost wounds per point tournant, and only if this opératif isn't hors de combat).

opTypes.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, PSYKER, MALIGNANT PLAGUECASTER

abilities.description:
During each friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif's activation, it can perform either two Tirer actions or two Combattre actions.
If it is two Tirer actions, a bolt pistol, boltgun or PSYCHIC weapon must be selected for at least one of them.
You cannot select the same PSYCHIC ranged weapon more than once per activation.  

Each friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.
Whenever an dés d'attaque inflicts damage of 3 or more on a friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif, roll one D6: on a 4+, subtract 1 from that inflicted damage.

**PSYCHIC**
Select one opératif ennemi visible to and within 7" of this opératif, or one opératif ennemi that's a valid target for this opératif.
That opératif ennemi gains one of your Poison tokens (if it does not already have one). If it already has one, inflict 3 damage on that opératif ennemi instead.  

Un opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

**PSYCHIC** Select one opératif allié visible to and within 3" of this opératif, then roll 2D6: if the result is 7, the selected opératif regains 7 lost wounds; otherwise, the selected opératif regains lost wounds equal to the highest D6.  
 Un opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi, or more than once per point tournant.

opTypes.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, BOMBARDIER

If it is two Tirer actions, a bolt pistol, boltgun or PSYCHIC weapon must be selected for at least one of them.
You cannot select the same PSYCHIC ranged weapon more than once per activation.  

Each friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.
Whenever an dés d'attaque inflicts damage of 3 or more on a friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif, roll one D6: on a 4+, subtract 1 from that inflicted damage.

This opératif can use blight and krak grenades (see faction and universal equipment).
Doing so doesn't count towards any limited uses you have (i.e. if you also select those grenades from equipment for other opératifs).
Whenever it's doing so, improve the Hit stat of that weapon by 1 and blight grenades have the Toxic weapon rule.

opTypes.keywords: PLAGUE MARINE, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, FIGHTER

abilities.description:
During each friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif's activation, it can perform either two Tirer actions or two Combattre actions.
If it is two Tirer actions, a bolt pistol, boltgun or PSYCHIC weapon must be selected for at least one of them.
You cannot select the same PSYCHIC ranged weapon more than once per activation.

Whenever an dés d'attaque inflicts damage of 3 or more on a friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif, roll one D6: on a 4+, subtract 1 from that inflicted damage.

Inflict D3+2 damage on each other opératif that's both visible to and within 2" of this opératif. Roll separately for each: if it's an opératif ennemi, if the D3 result is a 3, that opératif ennemi also gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn't already have one).  
 This opératif cannot perform this action while it has a Conceal order, or during an activation in which it has performed more than one Combattre action, and it cannot perform more than one Combattre action during an activation in which it performs this action.

Whenever this opératif is within your opponent's territory, the Contagion strategy ploy costs you 0CP.

abilities.description:
During each friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif's activation, it can perform either two Tirer actions or two Combattre actions.
If it is two Tirer actions, a bolt pistol, boltgun or PSYCHIC weapon must be selected for at least one of them.
You cannot select the same PSYCHIC ranged weapon more than once per activation.  

Each friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.
Whenever an dés d'attaque inflicts damage of 3 or more on a friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif, roll one D6: on a 4+, subtract 1 from that inflicted damage.
Whenever Un opératif is shooting this opératif, dés de défense results of 5+ are succès critiques.

ploys.description: Place one of your Cloud of Flies markers in the zone de combat. Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif that is more than 3" from it, if that opératif allié is wholly within 1" of that marker, that opératif allié is obscured. In the Ready step of the next Strategy phase, remove that marker.

Subtract 2" from the Move stat of an opératif ennemi and worsen the Hit stat of its weapons by 1 (this is not cumulative with being injured) whenever any of the following are true:  - It has one of your Poison tokens and is visible to (or vice versa) and within 3" of friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératifs. - It is visible to (or vice versa) and within 3" of a friendly PLAGUE MARINE ICON BEARER opératif.

Whenever a friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif is shooting or fighting during an activation in which it has not moved more than 3", or whenever it is retaliating, its weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule.<hr/>
**Ceaseless:** Can re-roll any or all results of one value (e.g. all results of 2)

Select one opératif ennemi within 3" of a friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif, or one opératif ennemi that has one of your Poison tokens and is within 7" of a friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif.
Until the end of the selected opératif's next activation, subtract 1 from its APL stat.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif is fighting against or shooting against an opératif ennemi within 3" of it (or within 7" of it if that opératif ennemi has one of your Poison tokens),
after your opponent rolls their attack or dés de défense. For each result of 3 they roll, inflict 1 damage on that opératif ennemi, that result is treated as a fail and they cannot re-roll it.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif is hors de combat, before it is removed from the zone de combat. Each opératif ennemi visible to and within 3" of that opératif gains one of your Poison tokens (if they don't already have one); for each of those opératifs ennemis that already has one of your Poison tokens (including if they gained one during this action), inflict 1 damage on them instead.

Use this firefight ploy when an dés d'attaque inflicts damage on a friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif.
Until the end of the activation/contre-attaque, for the purposes of the Disgustingly Resilient rule for that opératif, always subtract 1 from the damage inflicted (to a minimum of 2) - you do not need to roll.

Use this firefight ploy during a friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif's activation or contre-attaque, before or after it performs an action.
Select one of the following:

- One opératif ennemi within 3" of that opératif gains one of your Poison tokens (if it does not already have one).
- Roll 2D6: if the result is 7+, one opératif ennemi within 7" of that opératif gains one of your Poison tokens (if it does not already have one).

equipments.description: You can ignore any changes to the stats of friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératifs from being injured (including their weapons' stats).

Friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératifs have the following ranged weapon (you cannot select it for use more than twice during the battle):
 
|**Name**|**ATK**|**HIT**|**DMG**|
|-----|:-----:|:-----:|:-----:|
|Blight Grenade|4|4+|2/4|
|**Weapon Rules**|
|Range 6", Blast 2", Saturate, Severe, *Poison|
Friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératifs' boltguns and bolt pistols have the Poison and Severe weapon rules.
Whenever an opératif ennemi that has one of your Poison tokens is activated within 3" of a friendly PLAGUE MARINE opératif, inflict D3 damage on it (instead of the normal 1).

description: Though less resilient than their baseline Human comrades, Ratlings are naturally excellent shots. It is said that Ratling marksmen can take the head off a Heretic from over a kilometre away. Coupled with their knack for staying out of harm's way, this makes Ratlings formidable snipers who can exact a withering toll upon superior enemy forces.
composition:
A RATLING KillTeam is composed of:

- 1 RATLING FIXER opératif with one of the following options:  
  - Battle Rifle, Fists
  - Sniper Rifle, Fists
- 10 RATLING opératifs selected from the following list:
  - BATTLEMUTT
  - BULLGRYN* with one from each of the following:
    - Grenadier Gauntlet or Power Maul
    - Brute Shield or Slabshield  
  - OGRYN*
  - BIG SHOT
  - BOMBER
  - HARDBIT
  - RAIDER
  - SNEAK
  - SNIPER
  - SPOTTER
  - STASHMASTER
  - VOX-THIEF

*You cannot select more than three of these opératifs combined. Up to three times, instead of selecting one of these opératifs, you can select one RATLING ploy to cost you 0CP for the battle.  

Other than BULLGRYN, OGRYN, and SNIPER opératifs, your KillTeam can only include each opératif above once.

opTypes.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, LEADER, FIXER

abilities.description: You can select one additional equipment option.

After each opératif ennemi's activation, before the next opératif is activated, you can perform a free Ruée action with one friendly RATLING opératif (excluding BULLGRYN, OGRYN, and SNEAK), 
but it cannot finish that move within 3" of an opératif ennemi unless it is not visible to every opératif ennemi when it finishes that move.
  

Each opératif allié can only do this once per point tournant, and cannot do so after the final activation of the point tournant.

**Strategic Gambit**
Select one opératif ennemi visible to this opératif.
Until the end of the point tournant, whenever a friendly RATLING opératif is shooting that opératif ennemi with a Rifle, that weapon has the Lethal 5+ weapon rule.

abilities.description:
Mines you select from Univeral Equipment inflict 2D3+3 damage instead, and fiendly RATLING opératifs (excluding OGRYN and BULLGRYN) are ignored for its effects (i.e. they cannot trigger it or take damage from it).
This takes precedence over the normal mines rules.

After each opératif ennemi's activation, before the next opératif is activated, you can perform a free Ruée action with one friendly RATLING opératif (excluding BULLGRYN, OGRYN, and SNEAK),

Each opératif allié can only do this once per point tournant, and cannot do so after the final activation of the point tournant.

When setting up equipment before the battle, you can set up to two of your Tripwire markers up wholly within your territory and more than 2" from other markers, access points, and Accessible terrain. The first time that marker is within an opératif ennemi's portée de contrôle, remove that marker, subtract 1 from that opératif's APL stat until the end of its next activation and end its action (if any), even if that action's effects aren't fulfilled. If it cannot be placed, move it the minimum amount to do so.

abilities.description:
Once per point tournant, after an opératif ennemi performs an action, you can interrupt that action (or contre-attaque) and perform a free Ruée action with this opératif.
Note this opératif cannot use the Scarper faction rule (it has this rule instead).

After each opératif ennemi's activation, before the next opératif is activated, you can perform a free Ruée action with one friendly RATLING opératif (excluding BULLGRYN, OGRYN, and SNEAK), 
but it cannot finish that move within 3" of an opératif ennemi unless it is not visible to every opératif ennemi when it finishes that move.
  

Each opératif allié can only do this once per point tournant, and cannot do so after the final activation of the point tournant.

Until the start of this opératif's next activation, whenever it is shooting, opératifs ennemis cannot be Obscured and the stationary profile of this opératif's suppressed sniper rifle has the Lethal 5+ weapon rule.


This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

opTypes.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, OGRYN

abilities.description: Whenever this opératif finishes moving during the Charge action, you can inflict 1D3+1 damage on one opératif ennemi within its portée de contrôle.

Whenever your opponent is selecting a valid target, if this opératif has a Conceal order, it cannot use Light terrain for cover.
Whilst this can allow this opératif to be targeted (assuming it is visible), it does not remove its cover save (if any).
You must spend 1 additional AP for this opératif to perform the Ramasser un Marqueur and Mission actions (excluding Operate Hatch).

opTypes.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, BULLGRYN

abilities.description:
Whenever your opponent is selecting a valid target, if this opératif has a Conceal order, it cannot use Light terrain for cover.
Whilst this can allow this opératif to be targeted (assuming it is visible), it does not remove its cover save (if any).

If this opératif has a Slabshield, it has a 3+ Save stat;
if it has a Brute Shield, whenever it is fighting or retaliating, each of your blocks can be allocated to block two unresolved successes (instead of one).
You must spend 1 additional AP for this opératif to perform the Ramasser un Marqueur and Mission actions (excluding Operate Hatch).

options.description: If this opératif has a Slabshield, it has a 3+ Save stat.
If this opératif has a Brute Shield, whenever it is fighting or retaliating, each of your blocks can be allocated to block two unresolved successes (instead of one).

opTypes.keywords: RATLING, IMPERIUM, ASTRA MILITARUM, BATTLEMUTT

abilities.description:
This opératif cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Ruée, Repli, Combattre, and Repositionner.
It cannot use any weapons that are not on its datacard.

Once per point tournant, after an opératif ennemi performs an action in which it moves, you can interrupt that activation (or contre-attaque) to use this rule. If you do, each friendly RATLING opératif (excluding OGRYN and BULLGRYN) within 6" of this opératif and within 2" of that opératif ennemi can perform a free Ruée action or a free Repli action, but it cannot move more than 3". In either case, each one cannot finish that move within 2" of an opératif ennemi unless it is not visible to every opératif ennemi when it finishes that move (if this is not possible for Un opératif, it cannot move).

After each opératif ennemi's activation, before the next opératif is activated, you can perform a free Ruée action with one friendly RATLING opératif (excluding BULLGRYN, OGRYN, and SNEAK), 
but it cannot finish that move within 3" of an opératif ennemi unless it is not visible to every opératif ennemi when it finishes that move.
  

Each opératif allié can only do this once per point tournant, and cannot do so after the final activation of the point tournant.

ploys.description:
Whenever a friendly RATLING opératif is shooting an opératif ennemi more than 6" from it, if that opératif allié has not performed the Charge, Repli, or Repositionner action during the activation,
or it is a contre-attaque, its rifle (if any) has the Balanced weapon rule.  

Note that opératif is not restricted from performing those actions after shooting.

Whenever a friendly RATLING BULLGRYN or friendly RATLING OGRYN opératif is shooting within, fighting within, or retaliating within your opponent's territory or within 3" of an objective marker, its weapons have the Balanced weapon rule.

Whenever a friendly RATLING opératif (excluding OGRYN or BULLGRYN) has a Conceal order and is in Cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Vantage terrain) except being within 2".

Whenever a friendly RATLING opératif is more than 6" from opératifs ennemis and has Heavy Terrain within its portée de contrôle, the Stationary profile of its rifle (if any) has the Silent weapon rule.

Use this Firefight Ploy during a friendly RATLING opératif's activation (excluding OGRYN or BULLGRYN).
Until the end of that activation, that opératif does not have to control a marker to perform the Ramasser un Marqueur or Mission actions that usually require this
(taking precedence over that action's conditions - it only needs to contest the marker), and having an opératif ennemi dans la portée de contrôle of it does not prevent it from doing so.

Use this Firefight Ploy after a friendly RATLING opératif that has an Engage order perfoms the Tirer action with a rifle. If it is more than 3" from opératifs ennemis, or not visible to every opératif ennemi, you can change its order to Conceal.

Use this Firefight Ploy when a friendly RATLING opératif if performing the Tirer action with a rifle and you are selecting a valid target.
Having other friendly RATLING opératifs within an opératif ennemi's portée de contrôle does not prevent that opératif ennemi from being selected.

equipments.description: Once per point tournant, whenever a friendly RATLING opératif is shooting with a rifle and you've rolled your dés d'attaque,you can use this rule if you haven't used the Lucky Round equipment during this activation. If you do, improve the Hit stat of its rifle by 1 until the end of that sequence.

Once per point tournant, whenever a friendly RATLING opératif is shooting with a rifle and you've rolled your dés d'attaque, you can use this rule if you have not used the Purloined Rations equipment this activation.
If you do, that weapon has the Severe weapon rule for that sequence.

At the end of the Select opératifs step, roll 1D3. If the result is:

- 1, you lose 1 CP
- 2, you gain 1 CP
- 3, your opponent loses 1CP
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly RATLING BULLGRYN or friendly RATLING OGRYN opératif, dés de défense results of 5+ are succès critiques.

description: Ravener kill teams are hyperadapted to such an extent that they are able to overcome all manner of a prey species' defences. Driven by alien synaptic imperatives, Raveners burrow with horrific speed to strike at prey from vulnerable angles, before using razor-sharp talons, chitinous claws and virulent biotoxins to enact the Hive Mind's will.
composition:
A RAVENERS KillTeam  is composed of:

- 1 RAVENER PRIME
- 4 RAVENER opératifs selected from the following list:
  - FELLTALON
  - TREMORSCYTHE
  - VENOMSPITTER
  - WARRIOR
  - WRECKER

Other than WARRIOR opératifs, your KillTeam can only include each opératif on this list once.

opTypes.keywords: RAVENER, GREAT DEVOURER, TYRANID, LEADER, PRIME

abilities.description:
Whenever determining control of a marker, treat the total APL stat of opératifs ennemis that contest it as 1 lower if at least one of those opératifs ennemis is within 3" of this opératif.
Note this isn't a change to the APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this. Whenever an opératif ennemi is within 3" of this opératif:

- Your opponent must spend 1 additional AP for that opératif ennemi to perform the Ramasser un Marqueur and mission actions.
- Your opponent cannot re-roll their attack or dés de défense for that opératif.

During each friendly RAVENER opératif's activation, it can perform two Combattre actions.  

Each friendly RAVENER opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order. Whenever it does:

- You can change its order first, or change its order instead of performing an action (for the latter, still treat it as having counteracted this point tournant).
- During that contre-attaque, if it doesn't perform a mission action it can perform a free Burrow action.

STRATEGIC GAMBIT if this opératif isn't hors de combat.  

Roll one D6 and compare the result to the number of the current point tournant; if the result is:

- Twice as high or higher, you gain 1CP.
- Less: inflict damage on this opératif equal to the result.

- Any other result, nothing happens.

At the end of the Set Up opératifs step, place your Tunnel marker numbered '0' on the zone de combat floor, wholly within your drop zone and touching your zone de combat edge.
As a STRATEGIC GAMBIT in the first four turning points, you can place your next numbered Tunnel marker on the zone de combat floor wholly within 5" of your preceding Tunnel marker.
This means that, as the battle progresses, you can have a series of sequentially numbered Tunnel markers (0, 1, 2, 3 and 4).
Once you have placed five Tunnel markers, don't place any more (i.e. if your battle lasts more than four turning points).  

Your Tunnel markers and the area between your sequentially numbered markers (i.e. between 0 and 1, 1 and 2, etc.), create your TUNNEL.  

In a zone de combat that uses the close quarters rules (e.g. zone de combat: Tomb World), your TUNNEL and the distance between your Tunnel markers can be measured through Wall terrain. In a zone de combat that uses the hazardous areas rules (e.g. zone de combat: Bheta Decima), for the purposes of the Restricted Movement rule, parts of a Tunnel marker that are touching a hazardous area are treated as a hazardous area.

When setting up a RAVENER kill team before the battle, your first two opératifs must be set up as normal.
Each other friendly RAVENER opératif thereafter can be set up underground: place it to one side instead of in the zone de combat.  

In the Firefight phase, friendly RAVENER opératifs set up underground are activated and can Contre-attaquer as normal. Whenever a friendly RAVENER opératif is underground, it cannot perform any actions other than Burrow.
At the end of the battle, each friendly RAVENER opératif that's underground is hors de combat.  

Friendly RAVENER opératifs can perform the following action:  

**BURROW (1 AP)**:  

If this opératif is underground, set it up on your TUNNEL in a location it can be placed (it's no longer underground, and it can be set up dans la portée de contrôle of opératifs ennemis).
Until the end of the activation/contre-attaque, subtract 2" from its Move stat.
Alternatively, instead of resolving the above effect, if this opératif is in the zone de combat and on your TUNNEL, remove it from the zone de combat: it's now underground.
Un opératif cannot perform this action while carrying a marker.

opTypes.keywords: RAVENER, GREAT DEVOURER, TYRANID, FELLTALON

- Select one opératif ennemi within 2" of this opératif. Alternatively, if this opératif is underground, select one opératif ennemi on your TUNNEL. Inflict D3+2 damage on that opératif ennemi and it gains one of your Poison tokens (if it doesn't already have one).
- This opératif can perform this action while underground (this takes precedence over the normal Burrow rules).

ploys.description: Whenever a friendly RAVENER opératif is on your TUNNEL it's in cover, unless it's within 2" of l'opératif actif. Treat this as cover provided by Light terrain (therefore it's affected by rules that prevent this, e.g. Seek Light and Vantage terrain).

Select one friendly RAVENER opératif in the zone de combat. That opératif allié can immediately perform a free Burrow action. If it's within 2" of your TUNNEL, it can immediately perform a free Repli or Repositionner action before it does so.

Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly RAVENER opératif:

- f that opératif allié has performed the Burrow action during that point tournant, you can re-roll one of your dés de défense.
- f that opératif allié is on your TUNNEL, you can re-roll any of your dés de défense.

Whenever a friendly RAVENER opératif is fighting:

- If it's performed the Burrow action during that activation/contre-attaque, its melee weapons have the Balanced weapon rule.
- If it's on your TUNNEL, its melee weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule.

Use this firefight ploy when an opératif ennemi is performing the Combattre action and selects a friendly RAVENER opératif on your TUNNEL to Combattre against.
In the Resolve dés d'attaque step of that sequence, you resolve the first dés d'attaque (i.e. defender instead of attacker).

Use this firefight ploy during a friendly RAVENER opératif's activation or contre-attaque, before or after it performs an action. During that activation/ contre-attaque, that opératif can:

- Perform the Repli action for 1 less AP.
- Perform the Charge action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi, and can leave that opératif's portée de contrôle to do so (but then normal requirements for that move apply).

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly RAVENER opératif is hors de combat. Before that opératif is removed from the zone de combat, inflict D3 damage on each opératif ennemi within its portée de contrôle (roll separately for each).
If that opératif allié is a VENOMSPITTER that's currently benefitting from the effects of its Distend Dorsal Sac action, inflict 2D3 damage instead.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly RAVENER opératif performs the Burrow action. Before that opératif is removed from the zone de combat, or after setting it up on your TUNNEL, inflict D3+1 damage on each opératif ennemi within its portée de contrôle (roll separately for each).
You cannot use this ploy in the Strategy phase, or during a FELLTALON opératif's activation or contre-attaque if it performs the Toxic Lunge action (and vice versa).

equipments.description: Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly RAVENER opératif, if you can retain any sauvegardes de couverture, you can retain one additional cover save. This isn't cumulative with improved sauvegardes de couverture from Vantage terrain.
Whenever a friendly RAVENER opératif is fighting or retaliating, whenever an dés d'attaque inflicts damage on it, roll one D6: on a 5+, inflict 1 damage on the opératif ennemi in that sequence.
Whenever a friendly RAVENER opératif is activated, it regains up to D3 lost wounds.
Once per battle, after rolling off to decide initiative, if a friendly RAVENER opératif is underground and an opératif ennemi is within 5" of your TUNNEL, you can re-roll your dice.

description: As the Great Gun reloads and its hallowed ammunition is transported across Hive Fissilicus, great processions of pilgrims and preachers accompany these holy relics to their final assembly points. They are far from a peaceful congregation, and any who seek to disrupt the great Day of Firing will find themselves lit by the flames and faith wielded by the Sanctifiers.
composition:
A SANCTIFIER kill team is composed of:

- 1 SANCTIFIER CONFESSOR
- 1 SANCTIFIER CHERUB
- 9 SANCTIFIER opératifs selected from the following list:
  - CONFLAGRATOR
  - DEATH CULT ASSASSIN
  - DRILL ABBOT
  - MIRACULIST
  - MISSIONARY with one of the following options:
    - Ministorum flamer; brazier of holy fire
    - Ministorum flamer; gun butt; holy relic
  - MISSIONARY with one of the following options:
    - Meltagun; chainsword; holy relic
    - Plasma gun; chainsword; brazier of holy fire
  - PERSECUTOR
  - PREACHER
  - RELIQUANT
  - SALVATIONIST

Other than PREACHER opératifs, your kill team can only include each opératif above once.  

Your kill team can only include up to four PREACHER opératifs.  

You cannot select an option that includes a brazier of holy fire more than once per battle.

opTypes.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, LEADER, CONFESSOR

abilities.description:
Whenever an opératif ennemi would perform an action during an activation or contre-attaque while visible to and within 6" of this opératif, you can use this rule.
If you do, roll one D6: if the result is higher than that opératif ennemi's APL stat:

- It cannot perform that action during that activation/contre-attaque (the AP spent on it isn't refunded). If it's a contre-attaque, that contre-attaque ends.
- You cannot use this rule again during the battle.

In each point tournant after the first, whenever this opératif is an ORATOR and performs the Charge, Repli or Repositionner action during its activation, you can use this rule before it moves. If you do, determine each other friendly SANCTIFIER opératif that's benefitting from the SERMON and is visible to this opératif (or vice versa). After this opératif ends that action, each of those friendly SANCTIFIER opératifs can immediately perform a free Charge, Repli or Repositionner action in an order of your choice (choose separately for each), but each cannot move more than 3" and must end that move in a location where they are still benefitting from the SERMON. If this opératif is hors de combat before this rule is fully resolved, e.g. from the Vigilance action's interruption (see close quarters rules, kill team Core Book), don't remove it from the zone de combat until this rule has been resolved.

STRATEGIC GAMBIT. Select one friendly SANCTIFIER opératif. If a friendly CONFESSOR opératif hasn't been hors de combat, you must select it.
Until you use this STRATEGIC GAMBIT again during the battle, that opératif has the ORATOR keyword.  

Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif is within 3" of a friendly ORATOR opératif (or 6" if the ORATOR is a CONFESSOR), that friendly SANCTIFIER opératif is benefitting from the SERMON.  

Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif is activated within 3" of a friendly ORATOR opératif (or 6" if the ORATOR is a CONFESSOR), that friendly SANCTIFIER opératif is benefitting
from the SERMON until the end of that activation (i.e. even if it then moves more than the distance requirement from the ORATOR opératif).  

Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif is benefitting from the SERMON, Normal and Critical Dmg of 4 or more inflicts 1 less damage on it.

opTypes.keywords: SANCTIFIER, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS MINISTORUM, CHERUB

abilities.description:
- Whenever determining control of an objective marker, treat this opératif's APL stat as 1 lower. Note this isn't a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.
- Whenever this opératif has a Conceal order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Vantage terrain).
- This opératif cannot use any weapons that aren't on its datacard, or perform unique actions other than Incentivise.

Whenever this opératif is performing the Charge, Repli or Repositionner action, it can FLY. If it does, don't move it.
Instead, remove it from the zone de combat and set it back up wholly within a distance equal to its Move stat horizontally of its original location (in a zone de combat that uses the close quarters rules, e.g. zone de combat: Gallowdark, this distance cannot be measured over or through Wall terrain).
Note that it gains no additional distance when performing the Charge action. It must be set up in a location it can be placed, and unless it's the Charge action, it cannot be set up dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

STRATEGIC GAMBIT. Select one friendly SANCTIFIER opératif. If a friendly CONFESSOR opératif hasn't been hors de combat, you must select it.

Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif is within 3" of a friendly ORATOR opératif (or 6" if the ORATOR is a CONFESSOR), that friendly SANCTIFIER opératif is benefitting from the SERMON.  

Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif is activated within 3" of a friendly ORATOR opératif (or 6" if the ORATOR is a CONFESSOR), that friendly SANCTIFIER opératif is benefitting
from the SERMON until the end of that activation (i.e. even if it then moves more than the distance requirement from the ORATOR opératif).  

Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif is benefitting from the SERMON, Normal and Critical Dmg of 4 or more inflicts 1 less damage on it.

SUPPORT. Select one other friendly SANCTIFIER opératif (excluding CONFESSOR, DEATH CULT ASSASSIN, MIRACULIST and ORATOR) visible to and within 2" of this opératif.
Until the end of that opératif's next activation, add 1 to its APL stat.
  
This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

Note this isn't a change to the APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.

Once per point tournant, when a ready friendly SANCTIFIER opératif is hors de combat while visible to and within 6" of this opératif, you can use this rule. If you do, before that opératif is removed from the zone de combat, it can perform one free action (excluding Combattre), and you can change its order to do so. It's then removed from the zone de combat as normal.

abilities.description: Whenever Un opératif more than 6" from this opératif is shooting a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif within 6" of this opératif, improve that opératif allié's Save stat by 1.

Select one friendly SANCTIFIER opératif within this opératif's portée de contrôle to regain up to 2D3 lost wounds.   
This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

ploys.description: Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif that's benefitting from the SERMON is fighting or retaliating, its melee weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule.

Each friendly SANCTIFIER opératif (excluding ORATOR) that's benefitting from the SERMON can immediately perform a free Ruée or Repli action in an order of your choice (choose separately for each and, for the latter, it cannot move more than 3").
Each that does so must end that move closer and visible to (or vice versa) a friendly ORATOR opératif. You cannot use this ploy during the first point tournant.
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif that's benefitting from the SERMON, you can re-roll any of your dés de défense results of one result (e.g. results of 2).
Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif is fighting during an activation in which it performed the Charge action, its melee weapons have the Lethal 5+ weapon rule.

Use this firefight ploy after rolling your dés d'attaque for a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif, if it's shooting against or fighting against an opératif ennemi that's within 3" of a friendly ORATOR opératif (or 6" if the ORATOR is a CONFESSOR).
You can re-roll any of your dés d'attaque.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif that has a weapon with the Blaze weapon rule is hors de combat, before it's removed from the zone de combat.
Each opératif ennemi visible to and within 2" of it gains one of your Blaze tokens (if it doesn't already have one).
Use this firefight ploy when an dés d'attaque inflicts Normal Dmg on a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif. Ignore that inflicted damage.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly SANCTIFIER ORATOR or SANCTIFIER MIRACULIST opératif is selected as the valid target of a Tirer action or to Combattre against during the Combattre action.
Select one other friendly SANCTIFIER opératif (excluding CONFESSOR, MIRACULIST and ORATOR) visible to and within 3" of that first opératif allié to become the valid target or to be fought against (as appropriate)
instead (even if it wouldn't normally be valid for this).
If it's the Combattre action, treat that other opératif as being within the fighting opératif's portée de contrôle for the duration of that action.
If it's the Tirer action, that other opératif is only in cover or obscured if the original target was.  

This ploy has no effect if it's the Tirer action and the ranged weapon has the Blast or Torrent weapon rule.

equipments.description:
Once per point tournant, one friendly SANCTIFIER opératif (excluding CHERUB, DEATH CULT ASSASSIN and MIRACULIST) can perform the following unique action:  

**SANCTIFICATION ORB (1AP):**

- Select one opératif ennemi visible to and within 6" of this opératif. That opératif and each other opératif ennemi within 1" of it takes a doused test.
For Un opératif to take a doused test, roll one D6: on a 3+, it gains one of your Doused tokens.
- Whenever a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif is shooting against Un opératif that has one of your Doused tokens with a weapon that has the Blaze weapon rule, that weapon also has the Seek weapon rule.
- After a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif uses a weapon that has the Blaze weapon rule against an opératif ennemi that has one of your Doused tokens, remove that token (even if the Seek weapon rule wasn't used).  

- This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.
Once per point tournant, when a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif is shooting or fighting, if you roll two or more fails, you can discard one of them to retain another as a succès normal instead.

In the Ready step of each Strategy phase, roll 3D6: if the result is less than the remaining wounds of a friendly ORATOR opératif, you gain 1CP.
Note that this is done before the Gambit step, so if there isn't a valid ORATOR opératif, you cannot use this rule during that point tournant (e.g. during the first point tournant).

Once per point tournant, when Un opératif is shooting a friendly SANCTIFIER opératif that's benefitting from the SERMON, when you collect your dés de défense, you can use this rule.
If you do, change one of the attacker's retained succès critiques to a succès normal (any weapon rules they've already resolved aren't affected, e.g. Piercing Crits).

description:
Scouts are the new recruits of a Marine Spatial chapter who have advanced far enough in the early stages of their training and biological transformation to take part in battle with the rest of the Chapter.
  
  

More lightly armed and armoured than full Battle brothers, their role is to range ahead of the main Marine Spatial force, preparing the way for the main advance by infiltrating enemy lines, sabotaging and gathering intelligence - causing as much chaos and disruption as possible.
composition:
A SCOUT SQUAD killteam is composed of:

- 1 SCOUT SQUAD Sergeant opératif with one of the following options:
  - Astartes shotgun, fists
  - Boltgun, fists
  - Bolt Pistol, Chainsword
- 8 SCOUT SQUAD opératifs selected from the following list:
  - Heavy Gunner with Fists, Bolt Pistol and Heavy Bolter
  - Heavy Gunner with Fists, Bolt Pistol and Missile Launcher
  - Hunter
  - Sniper
  - Tracker
  - Warrior with one of the following options:
    - Astartes Shotgun, fists
    - Boltgun, Fists
    - Bolt Pistol, Combat Blade

Other than Warrior opératifs, your Killteam can only include each opératif once.

opTypes.keywords: SCOUT SQUAD, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, LEADER, SERGEANT

abilities.description:
During this opératif's activation, it can perform either 2 Tirer actions or 2 Combattre actions.
If it is 2 Tirer actions, an Astartes Shotgun, Bolt Pistol, or Boltgun must be selected for at least one of them.
This opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.

At the end of the Set Up opératifs step, you can select and resolve up to six Forward Scouting options.
Each option has a number in brackets which is the maximum number of times you can select and resolve it for the battle.
For example, your five selections could be Repositionner (2), Trip Alarm (1), Booby Trap (1) and Diversion (1).
If both players have this rule, alternate resolving selection by selection, starting with the player that has initiative.  
  

**BOOBY TRAP (1):**  

Place one of your Booby Trap markers more than 6" from your opponent's drop zone and more than 2" from other markers, access points, and Accessible terrain.
The first time your Booby Trap marker is within an opératif ennemi's portée de contrôle, remove that marker and inflict 2D3 damage on that opératif.
If it is not hors de combat, end its action (if any), even if that action's effects are not fulfilled.
If it cannot be placed, move it the minimum amount to do so.  
  

**DESIGNATE TARGET (1):**  

Select one opératif ennemi to gain one of your Target tokens.
Whenever a friendly SCOUT SQUAD opératif is shooting against, fighting against, or retaliating against an opératif ennemi that has one of your Target tokens, you can re-roll once of your dés d'attaque.  
  

**DEVISE PLAN (1):**  

You gain 1CP.  



**DIVERSION (1):**  

Once per battle STRATEGIC GAMBIT. Select one opératif ennemi within 6" of a zone de combat edge.
Until the end of that opératif's next activation, subtract 1 from its APL stat.  
  

**REDEPLOY (1):**  

Change the set up of one third of your opératifs (Rounding up).  
  

**Repositionner (2):**  

Perform a free Repositionner action with one opératif allié that is wholly within your drop zone.
It must end that move wholly within 3" of your drop zone.  
  

**SPY (1):**  

APPROVED OPS ONLY. Your opponent must reveal their selected tac op.  
  

**TRIP ALARM (2):**  

Place one of your Trip Alarm markers more than 6" from your opponent's drop zone.
During the first and second point tournant, whenever a friendly Scout Squad opératif is shooting an enemy that is within 2" of that marker, its range weapons have the Seek Weapon rule.
In the ready step of the third Strategy phase, remove that marker.  
  

**TACTICAL MANOEUVRE (1):**  

Once per battle STRATEGIC GAMBIT. Select one opératif allié. Until the end of that opératif's next activation, add 1 to its APL stat.

Once during each of this opératif's activations, you can select one other friendly SCOUT SQUAD opératif visible to it.
Until the end of that opératif's next activation, add 1 to its APL stat.

opTypes.keywords: SCOUT SQUAD, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, HEAVY GUNNER
SCOUT SQUAD, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, HUNTER

abilities.description: Whenever this opératif performs the Charge action during its activation, if it climbs, drops, jumps, or its base moves underneath Vantage terrain during that action, its melee weapons have the Lethal 3+ weapon rule until the end of that activation.
Whenever this opératif is climbing up, you can treat the vertical distance as 2" (regardless of how far the opératif moves vertically).

abilities.description:
Whenever Un opératif is shooting this opératif:

- Ignore the Saturate weapon rule.
- If you can retain any sauvegardes de couverture, you can retain one additional cover save, or you can retain one cover save as a succès critique instead. This is not cumulative with improved sauvegardes de couverture from vantage terrain.

Until the start of this opératif's next activation, whenever it is shooting, opératifs ennemis cannot be obscured.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

abilities.description:
Until the start of this opératif's next activation or until it is hors de combat (whichever comes first),
whenever a friendly SCOUT SQUAD opératif is shooting an opératif ennemi within 8" of this opératif,
that opératif ennemi cannot be obscured.
If that opératif allié is a SNIPER that is currently benefitting from the effects of its Optics action, its ranged weapons also have the Seek Light weapon rule.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

Select one expended opératif ennemi within 8" of this opératif. Until the end of the point tournant, whenever a friendly SCOUT SQUAD opératif is shooting that opératif ennemi, its ranged weapons have the Seek Light rule.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

opTypes.keywords: SCOUT SQUAD, IMPERIUM, ADEPTUS ASTARTES, WARRIOR

abilities.description:
You can do one of each of the following once per point tournant.

- One friendly SCOUT SQUAD WARRIOR can perform the Smoke Grenade action.
- One friendly SCOUT SQUAD WARRIOR can perform the Stun Grenade action.

The rules for these actions are found in universal equipment. Performing these actions using this rule does not count towards their action limits (i.e, if you select those grenades from equipment).

ploys.description:
Whenever a friendly SCOUT SQUAD opératif is shooting or fighting during its activation, if its order was changed from Conceal to Engage at the start of that activation, or it was not visible to opératifs ennemis at the start of that activation:

- Its weapons have the Balanced weapon rule.
- If the target is expended, its  weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule instead.
  
**Ceaseless:** Can re-roll any or all results of one value (e.g. all results of 2)  
**Balanced:** Can re-roll one Attack die.
You can change the order of up to D3 friendly SCOUT SQUAD opératifs that are more than 6" from opératifs ennemis to Engage.

Whenever an opératif ennemi is shooting a friendly SCOUT SQUAD opératif, if that opératif allié is in cover and more than 6" from opératifs ennemis it is visible to, you can re- roll one of your dés de défense.

Up to D3 friendly SCOUT SQUAD opératifs that have a Conceal order and are more than 6" from opératifs ennemis can immediately perform a free Ruée action. You cannot use this ploy during the first point tournant.

Use this firefight ploy during a friendly SCOUT SQUAD opératif's activation.
Until the end of that activation, that opératif can either perform 2 Combattre actions, or 2 Tirer actions if an Astartes Shotgun, Bolt Pistol, or Boltgun is selected for at least one of them.

Use this firefight ploy during a friendly SCOUT SQUAD opératif's activation. Until the start of its next activation, while that opératif has a Conceal order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Seek, Vantage terrain) except being within 2".

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly SCOUT SQUAD opératif performs the Combattre or Tirer action. If it is the first opératif allié to perform either of those actions during this point tournant, or if the opératif ennemi in that action (Primary target, if relevant) has a higher Wounds stat than that friendly Scout Squad opératif, you can retain one of your succès normaux as a succès critique instead.

Use this firefight ploy during a friendly SCOUT SQUAD opératif's activation.
Until the start of its next activation, you can ignore any changes to that opératif's stats from being injured (including its weapons' stats).

equipments.description:
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly SCOUT SQUAD opératif (excluding SNIPER), if you can retain any sauvegardes de couverture, you can retain one additional cover save.  
 This is not cumulative with improved sauvegardes de couverture from vantage terrain.

Friendly SCOUT SQUAD opératifs have the following melee weapon. Note that some opératifs already have this weapon but with better stats; in that instance, use the better version.

|**Name**|**ATK**|**HIT**|**DMG**|
|Combat Blade|3|3+|4/5|

Whenever a friendly SCOUT SQUAD HEAVY GUNNER opératif is shooting with a heavy bolter or missile launcher, if it has not moved during the activation, or if it is a contre-attaque, that weapon has the Ceaseless rule; if the weapon already has that weapon rule it has the Relentless weapon rule. Note that opératif is not restricted from moving after shooting.<hr/>
**Ceaseless:** Can re-roll any or all results of one value (e.g. all results of 2)  

**Relentless:** Can re-roll any or all dés d'attaque

Up to twice per point tournant, when a friendly SCOUT SQUAD opératif is performing the Tirer action and you are selecting a valid target, you can use this rule. If you do, until the end of that action, its ranged weapons have the Lethal 5+ and Saturate weapon rules.<hr/> **Saturate:** The defender cannot retain sauvegardes de couverture.

description:
"It doesn't matter who or what the enemy are. If they stand between us and following our orders, they'll die for it."  

*--Tempestus Aquilon Therka Drayv, prior to the Ossinium Drop*
composition:
A TEMPESTUS AQUILON KillTeam is composed of:

- 1 TEMPESTUS AQUILON TEMPESTOR opératif with one of the following options:
  - Hot-Shot Laspistol; Power Weapon
  - Relic Bolt Pistol; Chainsword
  - Hot-Shot Lascarbine; Fists
- 1 SERVO-SENTRY with one of the following options:
  - Flamer
  - Grenade Launcher
  - Hot-Shot Volley Gun
- 9 TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératifs selected from the following list:
  - GRENADIER
  - GUNFIGHTER
  - GUNNER with Melta Carbine and Fists
  - GUNNER with Plasma Carbine and Fists
  - MARKSMAN
  - PRECURSOR
  - TROOPER

Other than TROOPER opératifs, your killteam can only include each opératif above once.

opTypes.keywords: TEMPESTUS AQUILON, IMPERIUM, LEADER, TEMPESTOR

abilities.description:
When setting up a TEMPESTUS AQUILON kill team before the battle, the first third of your kill team must be set up as normal.
Each third thereafter can be set up above: place them to one side instead of in the zone de combat.
For each third that is set up above, you must set up the whole third in this way (not some of them), then place your Drop markers wholly within your drop zone.
  

As a STRATEGIC GAMBIT in the first and second point tournant, you can move your Drop markers up to 4", measuring the horizontal distance only. In close quarters, this can be measured and moved through walls.
  

During the Firefight Phase, friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératifs set up above are activated as normal.
When you do, you can either expend or land that opératif. If it lands, set it up in the zone de combat in a location it can be placed as follows (it is no longer set up above):

- Within 3" of one of your Drop markers, measuring the horizontal distance only, or wholly within your drop zone.
- Not dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi (unless you're setting up a PRECURSOR opératif, which can be set up dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi)
- With no part of its base underneath Vantage terrain
- With an order of your choice

The opératif is treated as performing the Repositionner action (spent the AP accordingly), then continue its activation as normal. It is Obscured until the end of the next activation or the end of the point tournant (whichever comes first).  

Less than half of your opératifs can be set up above by the end of the first point tournant. In other words, by the end of the first point tournant, more than half of your opératifs must have been set up in the zone de combat during the battle.  

When readying your opératifs during the second and third Turning Points, remove one of your Drop markers. This means opératifs still set up above are hors de combat at the end of the second point tournant.
Whenever a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératif is dropping, ignore the vertical distance.

Once per battle, you can either use a Firefight Ploy for 0 CP if this is the specific TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératif, or the Command Re-Roll Firefight Ploy for 0 CP if this is the opératif the attack or defence die was rolled for.

**Support:** Select one friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératif (excluding SERVO-SENTRY) Visible To and within 6" of this opératif. Until the end of that opératif's next activation, add 1 to its APL stat.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

opTypes.keywords: TEMPESTUS AQUILON, IMPERIUM, GRENADIER

STRATEGIC GAMBIT in the first Strategy Phase. Each friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON TROOPER opératif wholly within your drop zone can immediately perform a free Repositionner action, but must finish that action wholly within 3" of your drop zone.
When this opératif lands, you can set it up within 4" of one of your Drop markers (measuring horizontal distance only), taking precedence over the normal distance requirement.

ploys.description: Select one marker.  - Until the Ready step of the next point tournant, when determining control of that marker, treat the total APL stat of friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératifs that contest it as 1 higher, as long as at least one friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératif actually contests it. - Whenever a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératif is within 3" of that marker, add 1 to the Atk stat of its Melee weapons (to a maximum of 4).

Select one opératif ennemi. That opératif and all other opératifs ennemis within 3" of it gain one of your Detected tokens until the end of the point tournant.
Whenever an opératif ennemi with a Detected token:

- Is shooting a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératif, you can re-roll one of your dés de défense.
- Is fighting or retaliating against a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératif, one of your blocks can be allocated to block two unresolved successes (instead of one).

Whenever a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératif is shooting against or fighting against a ready opératif ennemi, its weapons have the Severe weapon rule.  
**Severe:** If you do not retain any succès critiques, you can change one of your succès normaux to a succès critique. Any rules that take effect as a result of retaining a succès critique (e.g. Devastating, Piercing Crits, etc.) still do.

Count the number of friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératifs that are not hors de combat, then halve the result (rounding up) to give you x.
Until the end of their activation, friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératifs' weapons have the Balanced weapon rule if they are the first opératifs alliés activated this point tournant equal to x.
For example if you have five opératifs, the first three activated will benefit.  
**Balanced:** Can re-roll one Attack die.

Use this Firefight Ploy when a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératif lands. You can set it up within 5" of one of your Drop markers (measuring horizontal distance only), taking precedence over the normal distance requirement.
It cannot perform the Ruée, Combattre, or Tirer actions during this point tournant.

Use this Firefight Ploy after rolling dés d'attaque for a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératif that is wholly within your opponent's territory, or either landed or dropped from Vantage terrain at least 2" higher than the zone de combat floor during this activation. If the target is within 6" of it, you can re-roll any of your dés d'attaque.

Use this Firefight Ploy when a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératif (excluding SERVO-SENTRY) is activated.
It regains 2D3 lost Wounds, and during that activation you can ignore any changes to its APL stat.

Use this Firefight Ploy during a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératif's activation (excluding SERVO-SENTRY and any opératif with an APL stat greater than 2).
During that activation, it can perform the Ramasser un Marqueur, Placer un Marqueur, or a mission action for 1 less AP.

equipments.description:
Friendly Tempestus Aquilon opératifs (excluding SERVO-SENTRY) have the following Melee weapon:

|**Name**|**ATK**|**HIT**|**DMG**|
|-----|:-----:|:-----:|:-----:|
|Tempestus Dagger|3|4+|3/4|
You can ignore any changes to the Move stat of friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératifs from being injured.

Once during the battle, when a friendly TEMPESTUS AQUILON opératif that is set up above is activated, before expending or landing that opératif, you can move one of your Drop markers again. However, it cannot be moved closer to your opponent's drop zone.
Once during the battle, when rolling off to decide initiative, you can re-roll your D6.

description: The Lieutenant Titus Mission Pack is a spin-off of Warhammer 40,000: kill team. Its parent game includes an expanded range of detailed miniatures, evocative terrain and unique rules. Combattre tactical battles against opponents with your team of elite opératifs, all set within the grim darkness of the far future.
composition:
One of each of the Space Marines.

1 Tyranid Warrior and 6 NPOs containing any combination of Hormagaunts and Termagants. Set them up within 3" of objective marker 1, with intervening terrain within their portée de contrôle when viewed from the player drop zone.

abilities.description:
Player opératifs within 6" of this opératif regain up to D3+3 lost wounds (roll separately for each), then remove all Mortal Wound tokens from those opératifs.  
 This opératif cannot perform this action more than once per battle.

Inflict D3+3 damage on each opératif ennemi within 3" of this opératif (roll separately for each).  
This opératif cannot perform this action more than once per battle.

Until the end of this opératif's next activation, whenever a player opératif is shooting, fighting or retaliating, add 1 to the Critical Dmg stat of its weapons, and its successes equal to or greater than 5 are succès critiques.  
This opératif cannot perform this action more than once per battle.

1. Combattre.  

2. Charge the closest player opératif via the shortest possible route.  

3. Repositionner towards the closest player opératif via the shortest possible route.  

4. Ruée towards the closest player opératif via the shortest possible route.

1. Repli. If possible, to a location where there's a valid target.  

2. Repositionner towards the closest player opératif, to cover if possible. Additionally, to a location where there's a valid target if possible.  

3. Tirer.  

4. Ruée towards the closest player opératif, to cover if possible.  

5. Combattre

1. Combattre  

2. Charge the closest player opératif via the shortest possible route.  

3. Tirer the closest player opératif.  

4. Repositionner towards the closest player opératif.  

5. Ruée towards the closest player opératif.
Whenever this opératif is hors de combat, before it is removed from the zone de combat, inflict D3 damage on each Hormagaunt and Termagant within 3" of it (roll separately for each).
Whenever a Hormagaunt or Termagant NPO is shooting or fighting within 3" of this opératif, retain one dés d'attaque as a succès normal for that opératif without rolling it.

1. Combattre.  

2. Charge the closest player opératif via the shortest possible route.  

3. Repositionner towards the closest player opératif, to cover if possible (a subsequent Ruée action can fulfil this, if able).  

4. Ruée towards the closest player opératif, to cover if possible.

After this opératif performs the Combattre action, it immediately performs a free Repli action, to cover if possible. Whenever this opératif is in cover from a player opératif, it is not visible to that player opératif.

description:
"So swift and so deadly are the Mal'Kor, it is as though they fury of the D'Yangi moon tempests had swept the enemy away. I almost pity those who stand against them"  

*--Shas'o Vior'la Shem*
composition:
A VESPID STINGWINGS killteam is composed of:

- 1 VESPID STINGWING STRAIN LEADER opératif
- 1 VESPID STINGWING OVERSIGHT DRONE opératif
- 9 VESPID STINGWING opératifs selected from the following list:
  - LONGSTING
  - SHADESTRAIN
  - SKYBLAST
  - SWARMGUARD
  - WARRIOR

Other than WARRIOR opératifs, your killteam can only include each opératif above once.

opTypes.keywords: VESPID STINGWING, T'AU EMPIRE, STRAIN, LEADER

abilities.description: Neutron weapons are any weapons that have the word "Neutron" in their name. Whenever a friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif moves or uses FLY, its Neutron weapons have the Piercing 1 weapon rule until the end of the point tournant.
Once during each of this opératif's activations, you can spend one Communion Point for free.

When selecting your opératifs for the battle, also select one VESPID STINGWING Strategy Ploy. Whenever this opératif is in the zone de combat and not dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi, that Ploy costs you 0CP.

Communion points are used to maintain the tactical focus of friendly VESPID STINGWING opératifs.
In the Ready step of each Strategy phase, you gain 1D3 Communion points, plus 1 if a friendly OVERSIGHT DRONE opératif is in the zone de combat.
Communion points are used as follows (OVERSIGHT DRONE opératifs are unaffected by the following):

- Whenever a friendly VESPID STINGWING ooperative is performing the Tirer action, it can only target the closest opératif ennemi within 8" of it (excluding opératifs ennemis dans la portée de contrôle of other friendly VESPID STINGWING opératifs) unless you spend 1 of your Communion points. For weapons with the Blast and Torrent weapon rules, only the first target must be selected in this way.
- Whenever a friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif performs the Charge action, it must finish the action dans la portée de contrôle of the closest opératif ennemi unless you spend 1 of your Communion points.
- Whenever you would perform the Ramasser un Marqueur or a mission action (excluding Operate Hatch) with a friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif, you must also spend one of your Communion points to do so.
- Whenever a friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif is shooting, you can spend one (and only one) of your Communion points to re-roll one Attack Die.

Whenever a friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif performs an action in which it moves, it can FLY.
If it does so, do not move it. Instead, remove it from the zone de combat and set it back up wholly within a distance equal to its Move stat (or 3" if it was a Ruée) of its original location, measuring horizontal distance only.
Note that it gains no additional distance when performing the Charge action.  

It must be set up in a location it can be placed, and unless it was the Charge action, it cannot be set up dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.
In a zone de combat that uses the Close Quarters rules (e.g. zone de combat Gallowdark), you cannot measure the distance over or through wall terrain, and that opératif cannot be set up on the other side of an access point (in other words, it cannot FLY through an open hatchway).

- This opératif cannot perform any action other than Aerial Guidance, Charge, Ruée, Repli, Combattre, or Repositionner. - Whenever determining control of objective markers, treat this opératif's APL stat as 1 lower. - Whenever determining what is Visible To this opératif, the round disc at the top of the miniature is its head. - Whenever this opératif has a Conceal order and is in Cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Seek, Vantage terrain) except being within 2". - Whenever Un opératif is shooting this opératif, ignore the Piercing weapon rule.

**SUPPORT:** Until the start of this opératif's next activation, whenever another friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif within 6" of this opératif is shooting an opératif ennemi Visible To this opératif, that opératif allié's ranged weapons have the Lethal 5+ and Saturate weapon rules. This has no effect while this opératif is dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.  
 This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

ploys.description:
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif while counteracting, or during an activation in which that shooting opératif moved or was setup, roll 1D6 whenever a normal sucess would inflict damage.
On a 5+, ignore that inflicted damage. A maximum of one Attack Die can be ignored per shooting sequence.

Whenever a friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif moves or uses FLY, its weapons have the Balanced weapon rule until the end of that activation.  
**Balanced:** Can re-roll one Attack die.
Whenever a friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif (excluding OVERSIGHT DRONE) is fighting or retaliating, Normal Damage of 4 or more inflicts 1 less damage on it.
Improve the Hit stat of friendly VESPID STINGWING opératifs' claws by 1, and those weapons have the Lethal 5+ and Shock weapon rules.
Use this Firefight Ploy when a friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif (excluding OVERSIGHT DRONE) is fighting and strikes with a succès critique. Inflict D3 additional damage.

Use this Firefight Ploy when a friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif performs the Tirer action during an activation in which it has used FLY. Until the end of that action, it gains all benefits from the first and second main features of Vantage terrain. When determining the height difference between opératifs for Vantage terrain rules, treat that opératif allié as being 3" higher than it currently is (but not when determining the distance for Communion).

Use this Firefight Ploy when you resolve a succès critique for a friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif that is shooting with a Neutron weapon during an activation in which it has moved or used FLY. If the target is within 4" of it, inflict D3 additional damage.

Use this Firefight Ploy when a friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif performs the Repositionner action. Until the end of that action, it can move an additional D3", or be set up an additional D3" away if it uses FLY. In either case, it cannot perform Combattre or Tirer actions for the rest of the point tournant.

equipments.description: In the Ready step of each Strategy phase, when determining how many Communion points to gain, you can roll two D3 and select one D3 to use.
Whenever a friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif (excluding OVERSIGHT DRONE) is fighting, its melee weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule.

Whenever a friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif (excluding OVERSIGHT DRONE) performs the Charge or Ruée action, it can move an additional 1". If it uses FLY for this action, you can set it back up 1" further away.
Once per point tournant, a friendly VESPID STINGWING opératif can perform the Ramasser un Marqueur or a mission action without spending a Communion point.

description: Even amongst the agile Aeldari, the Harlequins of the Void-dancer Troupes display an almost preternatural level of dexterity and skill. Performance and war merge in their actions, precisely directed to shape the fate of their race.
composition:
A VOID-DANCER TROUPE killteam is composed of:

- 1 VOID-DANCER TROUPE LEAD PLAYER opératif with one option from each of the following:
  - Fusion pistol, neuro disruptor or shuriken pistol
  - Blade, caress, embrace, kiss or power weapon
- 7 VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératifs selected from the following list:
  - DEATH JESTER
  - PLAYER with one option from each of the following:
    - Fusion pistol, neuro disruptor or shuriken pistol
    - Blade, caress, embrace or kiss    
  - SHADOWSEER with hallucinogen grenade and one of the following options:
    - Neuro disruptor; miststave
    - Shuriken pistol; miststave

Other than PLAYER opératifs, your kill team can only include each opératif on this list once. Your kill team can only include up to one fusion pistol and up to one neuro disruptor.

opTypes.keywords: VOID-DANCER TROUPE, AELDARI, HARLEQUINS, LEADER, LEAD PLAYER

abilities.description:
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif, and no dés d'attaque are retained as succès critiques, worsen the x of the Piercing weapon rule by 1 (if any). Note that Piercing 1 would therefore be ignored.  
 Whenever a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif is climbing up, you can treat the vertical distance as 2" (regardless of how far the opératif actually moves vertically).  
 Friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératifs can move dans la portée de contrôle of opératifs ennemis (they must still start and end the move following all requirements for that move).
Once per battle STRATEGIC GAMBIT. If this opératif is in the zone de combat, change the ALLEGORY you selected for your kill team. Note that the ACCOLADE rule opératifs alliés have will also change.

As a STRATEGIC GAMBIT in the first point tournant, you must select an ALLEGORY (Epic or Melodrama below) for your kill team for the battle, and one friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif to have the PIVOTAL ROLE for the battle.
Whenever a opératif allié has the PIVOTAL ROLE, it has the ACCOLADE rule of your ALLEGORY for the battle.  

As a STRATEGIC GAMBIT in each subsequent point tournant, you can select one friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif to gain the ACCOLADE rule of your ALLEGORY for the battle.  

Once per point tournant, when a opératif allié that has the PIVOTAL ROLE completes the performance of your ALLEGORY, you can select a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif to gain the ACCOLADE rule of your ALLEGORY for the battle.  

**Epic**  

- Performance:  
The opératif incapacitates an opératif ennemi while fighting.
- Accolade:  
Whenever this opératif is fighting, its melee weapons have the Balanced weapon rule.

**Melodrama**  

- Performance:  
The opératif incapacitates an opératif ennemi while shooting.
- Accolade:  
The opératif's ranged weapons have the Balanced weapon rule.

Whenever this opératif is fighting, its melee weapons have the Balanced weapon rule.

**Melodrama**  

- Performance:  
The opératif incapacitates an opératif ennemi while shooting.
- Accolade:  
The opératif's ranged weapons have the Balanced weapon rule.

opTypes.keywords: VOID-DANCER TROUPE, AELDARI, HARLEQUINS, PLAYER

abilities.description:
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif, and no dés d'attaque are retained as succès critiques, worsen the x of the Piercing weapon rule by 1 (if any). Note that Piercing 1 would therefore be ignored.  
 Whenever a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif is climbing up, you can treat the vertical distance as 2" (regardless of how far the opératif actually moves vertically).  
 Friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératifs can move dans la portée de contrôle of opératifs ennemis (they must still start and end the move following all requirements for that move).

Once per point tournant, you can use this rule. If you do, you can use a firefight ploy for 0CP if this is the specified VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif
(including Command Re-roll if the attack or dés de défense was rolled for this opératif). You cannot select the same firefight ploy for this rule more than once per battle.

As a STRATEGIC GAMBIT in the first point tournant, you must select an ALLEGORY (Epic or Melodrama below) for your kill team for the battle, and one friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif to have the PIVOTAL ROLE for the battle.
Whenever a opératif allié has the PIVOTAL ROLE, it has the ACCOLADE rule of your ALLEGORY for the battle.  

As a STRATEGIC GAMBIT in each subsequent point tournant, you can select one friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif to gain the ACCOLADE rule of your ALLEGORY for the battle.  

Once per point tournant, when a opératif allié that has the PIVOTAL ROLE completes the performance of your ALLEGORY, you can select a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif to gain the ACCOLADE rule of your ALLEGORY for the battle.  

**Epic**  

- Performance:  
The opératif incapacitates an opératif ennemi while fighting.
- Accolade:  
Whenever this opératif is fighting, its melee weapons have the Balanced weapon rule.

**Melodrama**  

- Performance:  
The opératif incapacitates an opératif ennemi while shooting.
- Accolade:  
The opératif's ranged weapons have the Balanced weapon rule.
