**PSYCHIC** Select one ready opératif ennemi visible to this opératif and roll one D6.
Until the end of the point tournant, that opératif ennemi cannot be activated or perform actions until it is the last opératif ennemi to be activated,
or until your opponent has activated a number of opératifs ennemis after this action equal to the result of the D6 (whichever comes first).  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

**PSYCHIC** Select one opératif ennemi that's a valid target for and within 8" of this opératif. Both players roll five D6. Pair your dice with your opponent's dice based on matching results. For each matching pair, inflict D3 damage on that opératif ennemi (to a maximum of 8). For example, if you rolled 6, 5, 5, 4, 2, 1 and your opponent rolled 6, 5, 4, 4, 3, 1, you would inflict 4D3 damage on that opératif ennemi.  
 This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

ploys.description:
Whenever a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif is fighting or retaliating and your opponent strikes with a succès normal, you can roll one D6:  

if the result is less than the Hit stat of your opponent's selected weapon, that strike is a block instead (ignore the Brutal weapon rule, if relevant) and you cannot use this rule for the rest of the sequence.

Whenever a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif performs the Repositionner action during its activation, it can perform the Tirer action during that action
(it must do so in a location it can be placed, and any remaining move distance it had from that Repositionner action can be used after it does so).
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif that performed an action in which it moved during this point tournant, you can re-roll one of your dés de défense.
Friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératifs can perform the Ruée action during the same activation in which they performed the Charge action, but not vice versa (i.e. not Ruée then Charge).

Use this firefight ploy when Un opératif is shooting a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif, during the Resolve dés de défense step.
You can allocate one of your rolled successful dice to block all of your opponent's dés d'attaque with matching results (e.g. one of your successful dés de défense results of 5 can be used to block all successful dés d'attaque results of 5).

Use this firefight ploy during a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif's activation. Until the start of its next activation, while that opératif has a Conceal order and is in cover, it cannot be selected as a valid target, taking precedence over all other rules (e.g. Seek, Vantage terrain) except being within 2".

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif is fighting during an activation in which it performed the Charge action, after you strike.
You can immediately resolve another of your succès normaux as a strike (before your opponent), or a succès critique if there are none.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif is fighting, after you strike with a succès critique, if the enemyu opératif isn't hors de combat.
End that sequence (any remaining dés d'attaque are discarded) and immediately perform a free Repli action up to 3" with that opératif (then the Combattre action ends).
That opératif can do so even if it's performed an action that prevents it from performing the Repli action.

equipments.description: Once per point tournant, when a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif is shooting, fighting or retaliating, if you roll two or more fails, you can discard one of them to retain another as a succès normal instead.

Once per point tournant, when a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif is performing the Tirer action and you select a shuriken pistol or shrieker cannon (focused), you can use this rule.
If you do, until the end of that action, that weapon has the Devastating 1 weapon rule.

Keep a Tragedy tally. Whenever a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif that has an ACCOLADE rule is hors de combat, add 1 to your Tragedy tally. When your Tragedy tally reaches 3, you gain 1CP and stop that tally.

Once per battle, when you activate a friendly VOID-DANCER TROUPE opératif, if the opératif allié that has the PIVOTAL ROLE has been hors de combat, you can use this rule.
If you do, that activated opératif has the PIVOTAL ROLE for the battle.

description:
Many are the dark and terrible secrets of the galaxy, and the Thousand Sons seek to learn them all. Gathering
relentless Rubricae and degenerate mutants, Warpcoven kill teams employ sorcery and savagery alike as they sweep
aside those who stand in their way.
composition:
A WARP COVEN KillTeam is composed of 5 WARPCOVEN opératifs selected from the following list:

- SORCERER OF DESTIN *(1)*
- SORCERER OF TEMPYRION *(1)*
- SORCERER OF WARPFIRE *(1)*
- RUBRIC MARINE GUNNER with one of the following options:
  - Warpflamer; fists
  - Soulreaper cannon *(2)*; fists
- RUBRIC MARINE ICON BEARER
- RUBRIC MARINE WARRIOR
- TZAANGOR CHAMPION *(3)* with one of the following options:
  - Greataxe
  - Greatblade
- TZAANGOR HORN BEARER *(3)*
- TZAANGOR ICON BEARER *(3)*
- TZAANGOR WARRIOR *(3)* with one of the following options:
- Tzaangor blades
  - Tzaangor blade & shield
  - Autopistol; chainsword

**(1):** With force stave, PSYCHIC weapons on their datacard and one of the following options:
- Inferno bolt pistol
- Prosperine khopesh
- Warpflame pistol

**(2):** Your kill team can only include up to one warpflame pistol and up to one soulreaper cannon.  

**(3):** These opératifs count as half a selection each.  

You must select at least one friendly SORCERER opératif.

Other than WARRIOR and GUNNER opératifs, your kill team can only include each opératif on this list once.

opTypes.keywords: WARPCOVEN, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, PSYKER, SORCERER, DESTINY

abilities.description:
During each friendly WARPCOVEN HERETIC ASTARTES opératif's activation, it can perform either two Tirer actions or two Combattre actions.
If it's two Tirer actions and a soulreaper cannon or a warpflamer is selected for both, 1 additional AP must be spent for the second action.
You cannot select the same PSYCHIC ranged weapon more than once per activation.
Each friendly WARPCOVEN HERETIC ASTARTES opératif can Contre-attaquer regardless of its order.
Whenever you select a SORCERER opératif for the battle, you must select a BOON OF TZEENTCH (below) for it to have for the battle. You cannot select each BOON OF TZEENTCH more than once per battle.

**PSYCHIC** Select one friendly WARPCOVEN opératif visible to this opératif. Until the start of this opératif's next activation,
until it is hors de combat or until this action is performed again by a opératif allié (whichever comes first),
whenever Un opératif is shooting that selected opératif, you can re-roll any of your dés de défense.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an
opératif ennemi.

**PSYCHIC** Select one opératif ennemi visible to and within 9" of this opératif.
Until the start of this opératif's next activation, until it is hors de combat or until this action is performed again by a opératif allié (whichever comes first),
whenever that opératif ennemi is shooting, fighting or retaliating, your opponent must re-roll their dés d'attaque results of 6, and whenever determining control of a marker,
treat that opératif ennemi's APL stat as 1 lower. Note this is not a change to its APL stat, so
any changes are cumulative with this.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

options.description:
You must select at least one friendly SORCERER opératif, and one of your selected SORCERER opératifs must have the LEADER keyword for the battle.
Add 1 to that LEADER opératif's Wounds stat for the battle.

This opératif's ranged weapons have
the Saturate weapon rule. Whenever
this opératif is shooting, enemy
opératifs cannot be obscured.
Add 1" to this opératif's Move stat.

Once per battle, when you Contre-attaquer with this opératif, you can change its order, and it can perform an additional 1AP action for free during that contre-attaque, but both actions must be different.
Add 1 to the Normal Dmg stat of this opératif's melee weapons.

Once per point tournant, when this opératif is performing the Charge or Repositionner action during its activation, it can FLY.
If it does, don't move it. Instead, remove it from the zone de combat and set it back up wholly within a distance equal to its Move stat of its original location, measuring the horizontal distance only.
In a zone de combat that uses the close quarters rules (e.g. zone de combat: Gallowdark), this distance cannot be measured over or through Wall terrain, and that opératif cannot be set up on the other side of an access point
(in other words, it cannot FLY through an open hatchway).  

Note that it gains no additional distance when performing the Charge action. It must be set up in a location it can be placed, and unless it's the Charge action, it cannot be set up dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.
This opératif's PSYCHIC ranged weapons have the Piercing Crits 1 weapon rule.

Having an opératif ennemi within this opératif's portée de contrôle does not prevent it from performing the Ramasser un Marqueur or mission actions.  

Once per activation, this opératif can perform the Ramasser un Marqueur, Placer un Marqueur or a mission action for 1 less AP.

Select one of this opératif's PSYCHIC ranged weapons. That weapon has the Devastating 1 weapon rule. If you select a doombolt, it has the 2" Devastating 2 weapon rule instead of Devastating 2.  
If you select Firestorm or Mindburn (SORCERER OF WARPFIRE), whenever that opératif performs the Tirer action, select the Seek Light or Devastating 1 weapon rule for that weapon to have until the end of the action (it cannot have both).

Select one of this opératif's PSYCHIC ranged weapons. That weapon has the Devastating 1 weapon rule. If you select a doombolt, it has the 2" Devastating 2 weapon rule instead of Devastating 2.  
If you select Firestorm or Mindburn (SORCERER OF WARPFIRE), whenever that opératif performs the Tirer action, select the Seek Light or Devastating 1 weapon rule for that weapon to have until the end of the action (it cannot have both).

Add 3" to the distance requirements of this opératif's PSYCHIC actions that have a distance requirement.   
Note that for the SORCERER OF TEMPYRION's Temporal Flux action, this boon only affects the distance in the first effect of that rule.

opTypes.keywords: WARPCOVEN, CHAOS, HERETIC ASTARTES, PSYKER, SORCERER, TEMPYRION

abilities.description:
During each friendly WARPCOVEN HERETIC ASTARTES opératif's activation, it can perform either two Tirer actions or two Combattre actions.
If it's two Tirer actions and a soulreaper cannon or a warpflamer is selected for both, 1 additional AP must be spent for the second action.

**PSYCHIC** Select one friendly WARPCOVEN opératif visible to and within 6" of this opératif. That opératif regains up to 2D3 lost wounds.  
 This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi, or if a opératif allié has already performed this action during this point tournant.

**PSYCHIC** Select one friendly WARPCOVEN opératif visible to and within 6" of this opératif and place your Temporal Flux marker within that opératif's portée de contrôle.  

At the end of that opératif's next activation, if it hasn't been hors de combat and is still wholly within 6" of your Temporal Flux marker, remove that opératif from the zone de combat and set it back up in a
location it can be placed;
when it is set back up, it must have your Temporal Flux marker within its portée de contrôle (or as close as possible).
Then remove your Temporal Flux marker from the zone de combat. If that opératif is not wholly within 6" of your Temporal Flux marker (including if it's hors de combat), remove that marker from the zone de combat.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi, or if your
Temporal Flux marker is currently in the zone de combat.

Note that it gains no additional distance when performing the Charge action. It must be set up in a location it can be placed, and unless it's the Charge action, it cannot be set up dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

If it's two Tirer actions and a soulreaper cannon or a warpflamer is selected for both, 1 additional AP must be spent for the second action.

ploys.description: Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly WARPCOVEN opératif, weapons with the Piercing 1 weapon rule have the Piercing Crits 1 weapon rule instead.

Friendly WARPCOVEN SORCERER opératifs' PSYCHIC weapons have the Balanced weapon rule if another friendly WARPCOVEN SORCERER opératif is within 9" of that opératif.   **Ceaseless:** Can re-roll any or all results of one value (e.g. all results of 2)   **Balanced:** Can re-roll one Attack die.

Roll 2D6 and reserve them (put them to one side). In the following Firefight phase, whenever Un opératif is shooting, fighting or retaliating, after you or your opponent roll their dés d'attaque, but before re-rolls, you can use one of your reserved dice to replace one of the D6 rolled for that sequence (yours or your opponent's); that replacement die cannot be re-rolled or retained as a success or succès critique if it is not, and is discarded at the end of that sequence. Then, if the combined result of both reserved dice was less than 9, discard the other die. You cannot use more than one reserved dice per sequence. Discard any remaining reserved dice at the end of the point tournant.

Friendly WARPCOVEN TZAANGOR opératifs' melee weapons have the Accurate 1 weapon rule.
Whenever a friendly WARPCOVEN TZAANGOR opératif is assisted by a friendly WARPCOVEN opératif, or is fighting while visible to and within 6" of a friendly WARPCOVEN SORCERER opératif,
that friendly WARPCOVEN TZAANGOR opératif's melee weapons also have the Severe weapon rule.  
**Severe:** If you do not retain any succès critiques, you can change one of your succès normaux to a succès critique. Any rules that take effect as a result of retaining a succès critique (e.g. Devastating, Piercing Crits, etc.) still do.  
**Accurate 1:** You can retain 1 Attack Die as a succès normal without rolling it.
Use this firefight ploy when an attack die inflicts Normal Dmg on a friendly WARPCOVEN RUBRIC MARINE opératif. That attack die inflicts 1 damage instead.

Use this firefight ploy at the end of a friendly WARPCOVEN SORCERER opératif's activation. That opératif allié can immediately perform a free Ruée action (even if it's performed an action that prevents it from performing the Ruée action), or you can change its order instead.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly WARPCOVEN TZAANGOR opératif is activated. Select one other ready friendly WARPCOVEN TZAANGOR opératif visible to and within 2" of it to activate at the same time.
Complete their activations action by action in any order.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly WARPCOVEN SORCERER opératif is activated. Select one other friendly WARPCOVEN SORCERER opératif visible to and within 9" of that opératif, then select one of that other opératif allié's PSYCHIC unique actions or PSYCHIC ranged weapons for that first opératif allié to have until the end of its activation.  
You cannot select a PSYCHIC ranged weapon that has been used by that other opératif allié during this point tournant, and that other opératif allié cannot use the selected weapon during this point tournant.

equipments.description: Friendly WARPCOVEN opératifs' inferno boltguns, inferno bolt pistols and autopistols have the Devastating 1 weapon rule.

Add 1 to the Atk stat of friendly WARPCOVEN RUBRIC MARINE opératifs' melee weapons. Whenever a friendly WARPCOVEN RUBRIC MARINE opératif is retaliating, its melee weapons have the Accurate 1 weapon rule.

Once per battle, when a friendly WARPCOVEN SORCERER opératif is activated or counteracts, you can select a different BOON OF TZEENTCH for it to have until the end of the battle (it loses any it previously had). It cannot be the same BOON OF TZEENTCH any other opératif allié has. Note that if you use this rule when a opératif allié counteracts and you select Echoes from the Warp, it can be used immediately to change the opératif's order and perform a free action during that contre-attaque.

Whenever an dés d'attaque would inflict Critical Dmg on a friendly WARPCOVEN SORCERER opératif, you can choose for that dés d'attaque to inflict Normal Dmg instead.
You cannot use this rule for each friendly WARPCOVEN SORCERER opératif more than once per point tournant.

description: Wrecka Crews are infamous Ork kill team Units, that love to commit explosive combat during their murderous rampages. They are considered the best of their species and are larger and stronger than the typical Ork. Wrecka Crews also make use of weapons that create explosions and the thought of this empowers them to become Tanked Up and ready to Combattre. These attributes and their use of 'eavy Armour, makes the Wrecka Crews incredibly durable and deadly in battle.
composition:
A WRECKA KREW KillTeam is composed of:

- 1 WRECKA KREW BOSS NOB opératif with one of the following options:
  - Rokkit Pistol; Smash Hammer
  - Two Rokkit Pistols; Choppa
- 2 WRECKA KREW BOMB SQUIG opératifs
- 5 WRECKA KREW opératifs selected from the following list:
  - BREAKA BOY DEMOLISHA
  - BREAKA BOY FIGHTER
  - BREAKA BOY KRUSHA
  - TANKBUSTA GUNNER with one of the following options:
    - 'Eavy Rokkit Launcha; Fists
    - Rokkit Launcha; Fists    
  - TANKBUSTA ROKKITEER with one of the following options:
    - Rokkit Launcha; Pusla Rokkit; Fists
    - Rokkit Launcha; Rokkit Rack; Fists

Other than BOMB SQUIG, BREAKA BOY FIGHTER, and TANKBUSTA GUNNER opératifs, your KillTeam can only include each opératif above once.

opTypes.keywords: WRECKA KREW, ORK, LEADER, BOSS NOB

abilities.description: Whenever this opératif performs a Combattre or Tirer action (excluding Vigilance), you gain 1 Wrecka point.

Whenever a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif is shooting, fighting, or retaliating, in the Roll dés d'attaque step:

- For each attack die result of 6 you retain, you gain one Wrecka point
- You can spend up to 3 of your Wrecka points (unless it's a BOMB SQUIG). For each point you spend this way, retain one of your fails as a succès normal instead of discarding it

You can gain and spend Wrecka points during the same action and can do so in an order of your choice, unless you started the action with 6, in which case you can only spend them.
If you start an action with 6 Wrecka points, you cannot gain any more during that action.

Select up to two valid targets. Tirer this weapon against both primary targets in an order of your choice, then against all remaining secondary targets in the same manner (roll each sequence separately).
Each target (primary or secondary) cannot be shot more than once during the action.

The first time a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif (excluding BOMB SQUIG) that has an Engage order performs either the Charge, Tirer or Combattre action (excluding Vigilance) during each of its activations/counteractions, add 1 to its APL stat until the start of its next activation.

opTypes.keywords: WRECKA KREW, ORK, BREAKA BOY, FIGHTER

abilities.description:
Whenever a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif is shooting, fighting, or retaliating, in the Roll dés d'attaque step:

- For each attack die result of 6 you retain, you gain one Wrecka point
- You can spend up to 3 of your Wrecka points (unless it's a BOMB SQUIG). For each point you spend this way, retain one of your fails as a succès normal instead of discarding it

You can gain and spend Wrecka points during the same action and can do so in an order of your choice, unless you started the action with 6, in which case you can only spend them.
If you start an action with 6 Wrecka points, you cannot gain any more during that action.

The first time a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif (excluding BOMB SQUIG) that has an Engage order performs either the Charge, Tirer or Combattre action (excluding Vigilance) during each of its activations/counteractions, add 1 to its APL stat until the start of its next activation.

Select a terrain feature within this opératif's portée de contrôle.
If it is Equipment terrain, remove it. Otherwise, place one of your Breach markers within this opératif's portée de contrôle as close as possible to that terrain.
Whenever Un opératif is within 1" of that marker, it treats parts of that terrain feature that are no more than 1" thick as Accessible terrain.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi, or if a terrain feature is not within its portée de contrôle.

opTypes.keywords: WRECKA KREW, ORK, BREAKA BOY, DEMOLISHA

abilities.description: The first time this opératif would inflict damage on an opératif ennemi with this weapon profile during the battle, separately inflict 1D6+6 damage on that opératif and each other opératif within that opératif ennemi's portée de contrôle if it is a succès normal, or 2D6+6 damage if it is a succès critique. Then the action ends and you gain 1 Wrecka point, plus 1 for each opératif that was hors de combat during that action. Damage from this weapon rule cannot be ignored or reduced.

Whenever a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif is shooting, fighting, or retaliating, in the Roll dés d'attaque step:

- For each attack die result of 6 you retain, you gain one Wrecka point
- You can spend up to 3 of your Wrecka points (unless it's a BOMB SQUIG). For each point you spend this way, retain one of your fails as a succès normal instead of discarding it

You can gain and spend Wrecka points during the same action and can do so in an order of your choice, unless you started the action with 6, in which case you can only spend them.
If you start an action with 6 Wrecka points, you cannot gain any more during that action.
Normal Dmg of 4 or more inflicts 1 less damage on this opératif; if this opératif has an Engage order, Critical Dmg or 4 or more also inflicts 1 less damage on this opératif.

The first time a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif (excluding BOMB SQUIG) that has an Engage order performs either the Charge, Tirer or Combattre action (excluding Vigilance) during each of its activations/counteractions, add 1 to its APL stat until the start of its next activation.

opTypes.keywords: WRECKA KREW, ORK, BREAKA BOY, KRUSHA

abilities.description: Whenever an opératif ennemi is shooting this opératif, or this opératif is fighting or retaliating, your opponent cannot retain dés d'attaque results of less than 6 as succès critiques (e.g. as a result of the Lethal, Rending or Severe weapon rules).

Whenever a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif is shooting, fighting, or retaliating, in the Roll dés d'attaque step:

- For each attack die result of 6 you retain, you gain one Wrecka point
- You can spend up to 3 of your Wrecka points (unless it's a BOMB SQUIG). For each point you spend this way, retain one of your fails as a succès normal instead of discarding it

You can gain and spend Wrecka points during the same action and can do so in an order of your choice, unless you started the action with 6, in which case you can only spend them.
If you start an action with 6 Wrecka points, you cannot gain any more during that action.

abilities.description:
Once per Tirer action, if this opératif shoots an opératif ennemi that another opératif allié has already shot during this point tournant, you gain 1 Wrecka point.
Determine this when you select a valid target, but you can include any secondary targets when doing so (e.g. from the Blast weapon rule).

- For each attack die result of 6 you retain, you gain one Wrecka point
- You can spend up to 3 of your Wrecka points (unless it's a BOMB SQUIG). For each point you spend this way, retain one of your fails as a succès normal instead of discarding it

Whenever Un opératif is withing x" of your Pulsa marker, worsen the Hit stat of its weapons by 1 and subtract 2" from its Move stat.
This is cumulative with being injured.
X is that marker's Pulsa points. In the Ready step of each Strategy phase, subtract 1 from your Pulsa marker's points.
If a Pulsa marker ever has 0 points, remove it.

The first time a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif (excluding BOMB SQUIG) that has an Engage order performs either the Charge, Tirer or Combattre action (excluding Vigilance) during each of its activations/counteractions, add 1 to its APL stat until the start of its next activation.

opTypes.keywords: WRECKA KREW, ORK, BOMB SQUIG

abilities.description:
Whenever this opératif is hors de combat during a battle in which it has not used its Explosives, roll 1D6, or 2D6 if you wish.
If any result is a 4+, this opératif performs a free Tirer action with its Explosives before it is removed from the zone de combat.

This opératif can perform the Tirer action with this weapon while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.
Do not select a valid target. Instead, this opératif is always the primary target and cannot be in Cover or Obscured.

This opératif is ignored for your opponent's kill/elimination op (when it is hors de combat, and when determining your starting number of opératifs). It is also ignored for victory conditions and scoring VPs if either require opératifs to "escape", "survive", or be hors de combat by opératifs ennemis (if it escapes/survives/is hors de combat, determining how many opératifs must escape/survive/be hors de combat, etc.).

Whenever a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif is shooting, fighting, or retaliating, in the Roll dés d'attaque step:

- For each attack die result of 6 you retain, you gain one Wrecka point
- You can spend up to 3 of your Wrecka points (unless it's a BOMB SQUIG). For each point you spend this way, retain one of your fails as a succès normal instead of discarding it

You can gain and spend Wrecka points during the same action and can do so in an order of your choice, unless you started the action with 6, in which case you can only spend them.
If you start an action with 6 Wrecka points, you cannot gain any more during that action.

During the Firefight phase, whenever you determine this opératif's order, you cannot select Conceal.
This opératif cannot perform any actions other than Charge, Ruée, Combattre, Repositionner, and Tirer, or use any weapons that are not on its datacard.

The first time a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif (excluding BOMB SQUIG) that has an Engage order performs either the Charge, Tirer or Combattre action (excluding Vigilance) during each of its activations/counteractions, add 1 to its APL stat until the start of its next activation.

ploys.description: Each friendly WRECKA KREW opératif that has an Engage order can immediately reagin 1D3+1 lost Wounds (roll separately for each).
Friendly WRECKA KREW opératifs' ranged weapons have the Saturate weapon rule.
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif that has an Engage order, you can re-roll one of your Defense dice.
Friendly WRECKA KREW opératifs' melee weapons have the Balanced weapon rule.

Use this Firefight ploy after a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif performs the Combattre or Tirer action; just before hors de combat opératifs are removed (if any).
Place one of your Demolition markers within the target's portée de contrôle (if it is using a Blast weapon, the primary target).
Whenever a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif (excluding BOMB SQUIG) is shooting against, fighting against, or retaliating against Un opératif that is within 3" of that marker,
you can spend a Wrecka Point for free (even if you have none).
In the Ready step of the next Strategy phase, remove that marker.

Use this Firefight ploy when an attack die inflicts Normal dmg on a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif (excluding BOMB SQUIG).
Ignore that inflicted damage.

Use this Firefight ploy when a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif performs the Tirer action and a weapon with the Blast weapon rule is selected.
Until the end of that action, add 1" to that weapons' Blast and it has the Severe weapon rule when shooting the primary target.
You cannot use this ploy and the Drill Rokkit rule (see equipment) during the same action.
Note that Sever does not generate a Wrecka point (as it is not a 6).

Use this Firefight ploy during a friendly WRECKA KREW BREAKA BOY or WRECKA KREW BOSS NOB opératif's activation.
During that activation, that opératif can perform two Combattre actions.

equipments.description:
Once per point tournant, whenever a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif is performing the Tirer action and you select a Rokkit Launcha or 'Eavy Rokkit Launcha, you can use this rule.
If you do, until the end of that action, that weapon loses the Blast weapon rule but has the Piercing 1 weapon rule.

Subtract 1" from the Move stat of friendly WRECKA KREW opératifs improve their Save stat by 1. This excludes BOMB SQUIG opératifs and isn't cumulative with the Protective rule of a Portable Barricade from universal equipment.

Once per point tournant, whenever a friendly WRECKA KREW opératif (excluding BOMB SQUIG) is activated, you can use this rule.
If you do, until the end of that activation, you can ignore any changes to that opératif's stats from being injured (including its weapons' stats).

When this item of equipment is selected, also select the Waaagh! or Destruction strategy ploy.
The first time you would use that ploy during the battle, it costs 0CP; whenever you would use it thereafter, it costs 0CP if you have any Wrecka points.

description: Genestealer Cults are insidious broods of Human-xenos hybrids that spread unnoticed on Imperial worlds, sometimes for generations. They infiltrate the Imperium's social, industrial and military fabric, and their elite Wyrmblade kill teams squirm undetected into perfect ambush sites.
composition:
A WYRMBLADE killteam is composed of:

- 1 WYRMBLADE NEOPHYTE LEADER opératif with one of the following options:  
  - Autogun; gun butt
  - Shotgun; gun butt  
  Or one option from each of the following:
  - Bolt pistol, master-crafted autopistol or web pistol
  - Chainsword, power maul or power pick
- 13 WYRMBLADE opératifs selected from the following list: 
  - KELERMORPH*
  - LOCUS*
  - GUNNER with flamer and gun butt
  - GUNNER with grenade launcher and gun butt
  - GUNNER with webber and gun butt
  - HEAVY GUNNER with heavy stubber and gun butt
  - HEAVY GUNNER with mining laser and gun butt
  - HEAVY GUNNER with seismic cannon and gun butt
  - ICON BEARER with one of the following options:
      - Autogun; gun butt
      - Shotgun; gun butt
  - SANCTUS SNIPER*
  - SANCTUS TALON*
  - WARRIOR with one of the following options:
      - Autogun; gun butt
      - Shotgun; gun butt

*These opératifs count as two selections each.  
Other than WARRIOR opératifs, your kill team can only include each opératif on this list once.  

Your kill team can only include up to two GUNNER opératifs, up to two HEAVY GUNNER opératifs and up to two CULT AGENT opératifs.

opTypes.keywords: WYRMBLADE, TYRANIDS, GENESTEALER CULTS, NEOPHYTE, LEADER

abilities.description:
Whenever a friendly WYRMBLADE opératif is shooting or fighting during its activation, if its order was changed from Conceal to Engage at the start of that activation, or it wasn't visible to opératifs ennemis at the start of that activation,
that opératif allié's weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule.

When setting up a WYRMBLADE kill team before the battle, one third of your kill team can be set up in HIDING: place them to one side instead of in the zone de combat.
CULT AGENT opératifs cannot be set up in HIDING.  

In the Firefight phase, friendly WYRMBLADE opératifs set up in HIDING are activated as normal.
When you do, you can either expend that opératif or have it emerge. If it emerges, set it up in the zone de combat in a location it can be placed as follows (it's no longer set up in HIDING):

- Wholly within 6" of your drop zone.
- More than 6" from opératifs ennemis.
- With an order of your choice.

The opératif is treated as performing the Repositionner action (spend the AP accordingly), then continue its activation as normal. If the opératif is a WARRIOR, ignore its Group activation rule.
opératifs alliés still in HIDING at the end of the second point tournant are hors de combat.
Once per point tournant, you can use the Slink Into Darkness or Coiled Serpent firefight ploy for 0CP if the specified friendly WYRMBLADE opératif is a NEOPHYTE visible to this opératif.

opTypes.keywords: WYRMBLADE, TYRANIDS, GENESTEALER CULTS, CULT AGENT, KELERMORPH

abilities.description:
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly WYRMBLADE CULT AGENT opératif:

- Ignore the Piercing and Saturate weapon rules.
- If you can retain any sauvegardes de couverture, you can retain one additional cover save, or you can retain one cover save as a succès critique instead. This isn't cumulative with improved sauvegardes de couverture from Vantage terrain.

Whenever a friendly WYRMBLADE opératif is shooting or fighting during its activation, if its order was changed from Conceal to Engage at the start of that activation, or it wasn't visible to opératifs ennemis at the start of that activation,
that opératif allié's weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule.
This opératif can perform two Tirer actions during its activation.

Whenever a friendly WYRMBLADE NEOPHYTE opératif visible to and within 3" of this opératif is shooting, fighting or retaliating, if this opératif has hors de combat an opératif ennemi during this point tournant, that opératif allié's weapons have the Severe weapon rule.

opTypes.keywords: WYRMBLADE, TYRANIDS, GENESTEALER CULTS, CULT AGENT, SANCTUS, LOCUS

abilities.description: Whenever this opératif is fighting or retaliating, you can resolve one of your successes before the normal order. If you do, that success must be used to block.

Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly WYRMBLADE CULT AGENT opératif:

- Ignore the Piercing and Saturate weapon rules.
- If you can retain any sauvegardes de couverture, you can retain one additional cover save, or you can retain one cover save as a succès critique instead. This isn't cumulative with improved sauvegardes de couverture from Vantage terrain.

Whenever a friendly WYRMBLADE opératif is shooting or fighting during its activation, if its order was changed from Conceal to Engage at the start of that activation, or it wasn't visible to opératifs ennemis at the start of that activation,
that opératif allié's weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule.

This opératif can perform two Combattre actions during its activation. Whenever this opératif ends the Combattre action, if it's no longer dans la portée de contrôle of opératifs ennemis, it can immediately perform a free Charge action (even if it's already performed the Charge action during that activation), but it cannot move more than 3" during that action.
Doing so doesn't prevent it from performing the Ruée action afterwards during that activation.

Once per point tournant, after an opératif ennemi performs an action in which it moves or is set up, you can interrupt that activation/contre-attaque to use this rule.
If you do, this opératif can immediately perform a free Charge action (you can change its order to do so), but it cannot move more than 3", and it must end that move dans la portée de contrôle of that opératif ennemi.
If this isn't possible, the interruption is cancelled and this rule hasn't been used.

opTypes.keywords: WYRMBLADE, TYRANIDS, GENESTEALER CULTS, NEOPHYTE, GUNNER

Whenever determining control of a marker, treat this opératif's APL stat as 1 higher.
Note this is not a change to its APL stat, so any changes are cumulative with this.

Once per point tournant, when a ready friendly WYRMBLADE NEOPHYTE opératif is hors de combat while visible to and within 6" of this opératif, you can use this rule.
If you do, before that opératif is removed from the zone de combat, it can either perform one free Tirer action (you can change its order to do so), or you can use the A Plan Generations in the Making firefight ploy for 0CP if that hors de combat
opératif is the specified friendly WYRMBLADE NEOPHYTE opératif.  

It is then removed from the zone de combat as normal.

opTypes.keywords: WYRMBLADE, TYRANIDS, GENESTEALER CULTS, CULT AGENT, SANCTUS, SNIPER

abilities.description:
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly WYRMBLADE CULT AGENT opératif:

- Ignore the Piercing and Saturate weapon rules.
- If you can retain any sauvegardes de couverture, you can retain one additional cover save, or you can retain one cover save as a succès critique instead. This isn't cumulative with improved sauvegardes de couverture from Vantage terrain.

Whenever a friendly WYRMBLADE opératif is shooting or fighting during its activation, if its order was changed from Conceal to Engage at the start of that activation, or it wasn't visible to opératifs ennemis at the start of that activation,
that opératif allié's weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule.

Select one opératif ennemi visible to this opératif. Until the end of the battle, or until this action is performed again by a opératif allié (whichever comes first),
that opératif ennemi gains one of your Soulsight tokens. Whenever this opératif is shooting an opératif ennemi that has one of your Soulsight tokens,
all profiles of this opératif's Sanctus sniper rifle have the Saturate weapon rule and that opératif ennemi cannot be obscured.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

Until the end of this opératif's activation, the stationary profile of its Sanctus sniper rifle has the Lethal 5+ weapon rule.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

opTypes.keywords: WYRMBLADE, TYRANIDS, GENESTEALER CULTS, CULT AGENT, SANCTUS, TALON

abilities.description:
Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly WYRMBLADE CULT AGENT opératif:

- Ignore the Piercing and Saturate weapon rules.
- If you can retain any sauvegardes de couverture, you can retain one additional cover save, or you can retain one cover save as a succès critique instead. This isn't cumulative with improved sauvegardes de couverture from Vantage terrain.

Whenever a friendly WYRMBLADE opératif is shooting or fighting during its activation, if its order was changed from Conceal to Engage at the start of that activation, or it wasn't visible to opératifs ennemis at the start of that activation,
that opératif allié's weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule.

This opératif can perform the Charge action while it has a Conceal order. Whenever this opératif performs the Combattre action, it can immediately perform a free Ruée or Repli action afterwards
(for the latter, it cannot move more than 3"), even if it's performed an action that prevents it from performing those actions.

Select one opératif ennemi this opératif isn't visible to.
Perform a free Charge action with this opératif, but do not exceed its Move stat (i.e. do not add 2"), and it must end that move dans la portée de contrôle of that opératif ennemi.
Then immediately perform a free Combattre action with this opératif against that opératif ennemi. The first time you strike during that action, you can immediately resolve another of your successes as a strike (before your opponent).  

This opératif cannot perform this action while it has an Engage order, or while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

Select one opératif ennemi visible to this opératif. Until the end of the battle, or until this action is performed again by a opératif allié (whichever comes first),
that opératif ennemi gains one of your Soulsight tokens. Whenever this opératif is shooting an opératif ennemi that has one of your Soulsight tokens,
its Sanctus bio-dagger has the Brutal and Balanced weapon rules.  

This opératif cannot perform this action while dans la portée de contrôle of an opératif ennemi.

opTypes.keywords: WYRMBLADE, TYRANIDS, GENESTEALER CULTS, NEOPHYTE, WARRIOR

abilities.description:
Whenever a friendly WYRMBLADE opératif is shooting or fighting during its activation, if its order was changed from Conceal to Engage at the start of that activation, or it wasn't visible to opératifs ennemis at the start of that activation,
that opératif allié's weapons have the Ceaseless weapon rule.

When setting up a WYRMBLADE kill team before the battle, one third of your kill team can be set up in HIDING: place them to one side instead of in the zone de combat.
CULT AGENT opératifs cannot be set up in HIDING.  

In the Firefight phase, friendly WYRMBLADE opératifs set up in HIDING are activated as normal.
When you do, you can either expend that opératif or have it emerge. If it emerges, set it up in the zone de combat in a location it can be placed as follows (it's no longer set up in HIDING):

- Wholly within 6" of your drop zone.
- More than 6" from opératifs ennemis.
- With an order of your choice.

The opératif is treated as performing the Repositionner action (spend the AP accordingly), then continue its activation as normal. If the opératif is a WARRIOR, ignore its Group activation rule.
opératifs alliés still in HIDING at the end of the second point tournant are hors de combat.

Whenever this opératif is expended, you must then activate one other ready friendly WYRMBLADE WARRIOR opératif (if able) before your opponent activates.
When that other opératif is expended, your opponent then activates as normal (in other words, you cannot activate more than two opératifs in succession with this rule).

ploys.description:
Whenever a friendly WYRMBLADE opératif is activated, if its order is changed from Conceal to Engage, until the end of that activation:

- Its ranged weapons have the Rending weapon rule.
- Add 1 to the Atk stat of its melee weapons (to a maximum of 5).
  
**Rending:** If you retain any critical hits, retain 1 normal hit as a critical hit instead.

Whenever Un opératif is shooting a friendly WYRMBLADE opératif that has a Conceal order, if Light terrain is intervening, that opératif allié is obscured (unless the intervening Light terrain is within 1" of either opératif).

Up to three friendly WYRMBLADE opératifs can immediately perform a free Ruée or Charge action in an order of your choice (choose separately for each, and for the latter, it cannot move more than 3").
If a WYRMBLADE CULT AGENT opératif is selected for this ploy, it counts as two opératifs, and it can perform a free Repli action instead (it cannot move more than 3"); if it does, subtract 1 from its APL stat until the end of its next activation.

Whenever a friendly WYRMBLADE opératif is shooting Un opératif that another friendly WYRMBLADE opératif has already shot during this point tournant, that first opératif allié's ranged weapons have the Accurate 1 weapon rule.  
**Accurate 1:** You can retain 1 Attack Die as a succès normal without rolling it.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly WYRMBLADE CULT AGENT or WYRMBLADE LEADER opératif is selected as the valid target of a Tirer action or to Combattre against during the Combattre action. Select one other friendly WYRMBLADE NEOPHYTE opératif (excluding LEADER) visible to and within 3" of that first opératif allié to become the valid target or to be fought against (as appropriate) instead (even if it wouldn't normally be valid for this). If it's the Combattre action, treat that other opératif as being within the fighting opératif's portée de contrôle for the duration of that action. If it is the Tirer action, that other opératif is only in cover or obscured if the original target was.  
 This ploy has no effect if it's the Tirer action and the ranged weapon has the Blast or Torrent weapon rule.

Use this firefight ploy at the end of a friendly WYRMBLADE opératif's activation. If that opératif has an Engage order, change it to Conceal. You cannot use this ploy for each opératif allié more than once per battle.

Use this firefight ploy when a friendly WYRMBLADE opératif is shooting or fighting, after rolling your dés d'attaque.
If that opératif allié's order was changed from Conceal to Engage at the start of that activation and this is the first time it has performed either the Tirer or Combattre action during that activation,
you can retain one of your succès normaux as a succès critique instead. Note this ploy cannot come into effect more than once per activation (you cannot use it during both the Tirer and Combattre action in the same activation).

ploys.ployName: A Plan Generations In The Making
ploys.description: Use this firefight ploy when a friendly WYRMBLADE NEOPHYTE opératif is hors de combat. It can perform a free mission action before it's removed from the zone de combat.

equipments.description:
Once per point tournant, a friendly WYRMBLADE NEOPHYTE opératif can use the following ranged weapon:
 
|**Name**|**Atk**|**Hit**|**Dmg**|
|-----|:-----:|:-----:|:-----:|
|Blasting Charge|4|4+|3/5|
|**Weapon Rules**|
|Range 4", Blast 1", Saturate|

Friendly WYRMBLADE NEOPHYTE opératifs have the following melee weapon:
 
|**Name**|**Atk**|**Hit**|**Dmg**|
|-----|:-----:|:-----:|:-----:|
|Cult Knife|3|4+|3/4|

This equipment allows you to select two mines (see universal equipment).
You cannot also select that equipment as normal (i.e. to give you three), and friendly WYRMBLADE opératifs are ignored for your mines' effects (i.e. they cannot trigger or take damage from them).
This takes precedence over the normal mines rules.

Whenever a friendly WYRMBLADE opératif is shooting, the target cannot be obscured if it is visible to and within 6" of a friendly WYRMBLADE NEOPHYTE opératif that is not dans la portée de contrôle of opératifs ennemis.
